We really enjoyed the large rooms and kitchen area that we had.  The kids were able to sleep in separate beds in a separate room which was nice.  It was conveniently located to the disney locations.  The service at check in was really good.  They were very nice and professional.  We are planning a family vacation down there this summer and are planning to try and stay here again.  My only recommendation would be a spot to park vehicles that might be pulling trailers.  There was not a good spot for that.  But we managed and had no complaints.

title: It feels like a home away from home.
review: On behalf of Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club, we would like to thank you for choosing us for your recent trip to florida! We are glad to hear you enjoyed your stay and received great customer service! We are always looking for new ways to make our guests experience as memorable and enjoyable as possible. We cant wait to welcome you back on your future summer vacation here in Orlando!   Sincerely, Katie R

title: Very nice accomodations and GREAT Value for Money...Definitely stay again!!!
review: The rooms are very spacious and comfortable- perfect for a short trip or an extended stay.  The location is convenient.  The area is quiet and ideal for relaxation.  We would definitely stay again, in fact, we have stayed at least 3 or 4 times before.

title: Resort is beautiful; service has declined
review: Thank you so much for choosing Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club once again! We deeply appreciate your loyalty as a returning guest and hope to continue to serve you in the upcoming years.  We are doing our best to continue to improve our resort and we hope we are not only continue to meet but exceed your expectations.    Sincerely, Katie R

title: nice place to stay
review: We were a bit apprehensive about staying here after reading some of the comments about the place not being very clean.  Fortunately, we did not have any problems and thought our unit and the grounds were very clean and neat.  Definitely great value for the money and would stay here again.

title: Mike Ditka's Beach Resort...Let us Ruin your stay in Orlando
review: Dirty rooms, horrible staff.  Lack of sheets for the beds, no wash clothes, coffee was in coffee maker when we got to room.  6 people staying in 3 bedroom villa and 2 rolls of toilet paper provided, asked housekeeping for more and was told "no, and if they had any, they wouldn't bring it down".  There were also no spoons, had to eat cereal with a fork!

title: It will literally make you want to RUN A WAY"
review: Please let us apologize for the difficulties and inconvenience you experienced during your stay with us here at Mike Ditka Reosrts-Runaway Beach Club.  We are deeply troubled that this issue has caused so much distress to you, our valued customer, and have looked into your complaint.   At Mike Ditka Resorts-Runaway Beach Club, we are in constant pursuit of perfection and are already working on solutions that will prevent similar problems from occurring in the future.  Our process will be stronger than ever and will help eliminate the problems you experienced.  Please accept our apologize for the difficulties and inconvenience you experienced.  Sincerely, Katie R

title: Mike Ditka's Runaway Resort: dirty and uncomfortable.
review: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  Let's begin this horror story by stating that upon check in we were told our room was not ready and had to wait; not a big deal, EXCEPT when entered our room we found another guest's belongings (i.e. laptop, cooler, etc).  Apparently, they had given us a room that was being utilized by another guest.  We could have easily stolen this person's belongings.  The girl at the front desk did not find this to be a big deal, she actually proceeded to inform us that "they are very disorganized" and that if "upon entering our new room we find anything else to please call her."  I guess this happens all the time at this place.   Upon getting our new room, we had no toilet paper and all our towels were wet, used, and dirty.  We called the…

title: The worst stay ever...
review: On behalf of Mike Ditka Resorts-Runaway Beach Club, I would like to sincerely apologize for the unpleasant experience that you had at our resort and would like to thank you for taking the time to bring this matter to our attention.  At Mike Ditka Resorts-Runaway Beach Club, we take pride in ensuring our customer’s satisfaction. Unfortunately, we did not meet your—or our own—expectations.  As a testament to our strive for perfection, we have taken steps to ensure that this will never happen again.  We deeply value your relationship with Mike Ditka Reosrts-Runaway Beach Club and are committed to providing our guests with the highest level of service simply because our customers deserve the very best.   Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience you  have experienced.  Sincerely, Katie R

title: Just what we were looking for
review: We chose Ditka's because it was centrally located  between Disney and Universal.  Tha location was great but the cleanliness wad atrocious!  I came with my parents and they took the bedroom which left me on the advertised fold out couch.  The couch should be classified as a bio-hazard.  It was ripped, dirty, stained, smelled like sweat, and actually had what I pray is dried food on it. When I got the courage to fold out the bed there were sheet already on it that were also stained.  Thay clearly had not been changed.  Food had fallen between the cushions and onto the bed.  There were pillows in a closet but these also were stained.  I asked for clean sheets at the desk but was told they couldn't do that.  Apparently they lock up the sheets and the front desk does not have a…

title: Nice Resort but shoddy room
review: The resort itself was attractive and in good location for our purposes at a reasonable price.  Our one bedroom villa was good size for our needs.  I've seen better sofas that were giveaways at the curb.  Lights were burned out.  Safety latch on door had long been broken. There were two dust pans but no broom.  Vacuum attachments, but no vacuum. Appliances were newer and worked well.  Kitchen had needed utensils but only one teaspoon.  It just seemed that attending to the little things could have made a much better impression on a first time guest.

title: Pleasantly Surprised!!
review: My wife and I found this resort via Trip Advisor and were a bit skeptical after reading the reviews but booked the room anyway.We were blow away once we got to the resort! A 2 bedroom condo for under $200 bucks a night! We are 2 families so we split the cost.There's an indoor air conditioned basketball court right off the lobby , a Tiki Bar at the pool with good drinks that are actually affordable!! The room was great , our room was clean and had a view of the lake. The staff was very nice. This was our first visit but we will be back in May and will be staying here again.

title: February ESPN field hockey and parks trip
review: Close to Disney, kitchen, laundry in house, comfortable and roomie enough for everyone.

title: Very affordable, clean, and convenient
review: This resort offers a great value, nice rooms and great location for the orlando resort area. Have stayed on 4 separate occasions and will again.

title: Perfect place for visiting Orlando, your own supplies required...
review: Recently, our family decided to take a Winter vacation in Orlando and chose to stay at Mike Ditka's Runaway Resorts.  This was our choice because it fit perfectly with our budget and plans, to visit several Orlando attractions with our young children and to enjoy the benefits of a condominium in a safe and quiet location.  The resort is within close proximity of Medieval Knights, Walt Disney World, Arabian Nights, Wonder Works, Universal Studios and much more.  On top of all that, the resort has exactly what our family enjoys, heated pools for all ages with access to a pool bar, a fitness room with aerobic equipment and free weights, a basketball court, complimentary wireless internet and excellent rooms to stay.  Since we read about the resort prior to our stay, we knew we…

title: Run for dear life
review: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life the carpet were dirty the bathrooms were filthy The shower didn't drain properly. There were no pots,dish towel,dish liquid soap,spoons,toilet paper,shampoo or conditioner in the room. When staying there just bring everything from home. They don't have any was cloth,towels pillows,blankets we had one was cloth for 7 people are you really serious ? Phone and the blow dryer didn't work we called for someone to fix it but no one came. Called the next day and was promised that it would be done today still no one came. Whoever runs this hole in the wall should be a shamed of themselves poor Mike Ditka bet he doesn't know what his named is attached too. I tried for days to get a hold of Sina the manager and she was never in her…

title: This place is a joke. Ditka Should be Ashamed
review: This has got to be one of the worst service oriented hotels/villas I have ever stayed at. We actually had booked a prior hotel before finding this hotel on the internet. Looked great and had nice price, so we re-booked and came her. Worst decision. Upon arrival there were dirty towels and nasty smoke pail with butts in it sitting on the front entance way. We went in and sofas were stained and there was a dirty stench. Both bathrooms were dirty and were barely cleaned. Both tubs had caulk pulling off tub and were black. Lastly we had 9 towels and one wash cloth. One roll of toilet paper and tv remotes failed to work. Called front desk and they said they would bring items down. 2 days later and still no supplies.. Went to Walmart and purchased ourselves. Stay on top floor, because…

title: Mike Ditka's Resort Now On A Downward Spiral
review: Current stay-very disappointing. After staying here several times over the past few years we are very disillusioned.  1. Missing hairdryer in the master bathroom.  2. Missing drain cover in 2nd bathroom tub.  3. Vacuuming was not done before our checkin.  4. No hand and face towels in bathrooms.  5. Bathroom floors were gross.  6. No bathroom tissues are included anymore. 7. The door of the in-room safe was missing.  The place has gone downhill over the past year. It's a shame. The location is great and the room layouts are nice. The service and amenities are now missing. A real shame.

title: The worst place I've ever stayed...and we travel ALOT!!!
review: dirty towels sitting outside our door and ash tray full (we are non smokers) when we first arrived.  Mold around bath tub.  Hair and dirt on bathroom floor.  Trim around bathroom sink was just laying on the counter. 9 towels and 1 wash cloth.  Was told they didnt have anymore so we had to go to walmart to buy some.  half a roll of toilet paper for our 9 day stay, was told they dont replenish.  Again had to go to walmart.  carpets are dirty and smelly.  Walls are paper thin you can here the conversations of the people above/next to you.  you have to wear a paper wrist band the entire time you are there to use their pool, if you lose it you have to pay $5 for a new one!!!!!  housekeeping leaves your door propped open when they arent in there!!!!!!!!  our car was damaged in their…

title: CAMPING AT A RESORT
review: Our third trip in the past three years to the Mike Ditka Runaway Beach Club.  There is a reason a "Under New Management" banner is NOT streaming over their entry way.  In the past, little essentials (e.g. toilet paper) has been provided for the asking by a friendly staff.  Not this year!  Their cover letter states "certain items are no longer provided" during the course of your stay, they just forgot to list which items you needed to pick up at Target (Wal-Mart is very, very scary!).  The staff was less than helpful, they could not make change, empty the full bucket of cigarette butts that greeted us on our arrival, fix our air conditioner to cool the room below 69F or clear the now defunct pool towel container.  All guest must wear a paper wrist band to use the pool (yes,…

title: Horrible Staff
review: We had business there and stayed at the resort[ which was beautiful and clean] and the price was great but when we went to check-out,that was when the problems began.They put pails with sand on the porch for smokers and that way there is no smoking in the rooms[ which we don't smoke in our own home] so that was great but when we were checking out we were told that we would be charged $269.00 for smoking in our rooms.I was stunned because we never smoked in our rooms and I tried to explain that but there was a young girl at the front desk with a nasty attitude and she simply told me that we did smoke in the rooms and she was calling police and they will go check to see if we did or not.So while we were waiting the manager came out and told us that we have not paid for our stay…

title: Run-amok Beach Club
review: I booked this hotel for an early Christmas visit with extended family.  This was our only time to get together.  I had called ahead early in the week to make sure everything was OK with the reservation and that late check in would be allowed.  When we all arrived on Friday evening, we were told our 3 bedroom villa had been given to someone else in error and that we were being put up in another hotel across the street.    The other hotel gave us two adjoining suites.  Unfortunately, they were smoking rooms.  The smell was horrible.  We tried to get non-smoking rooms but the hotel had nothing available.  We went back to the Beach Club and they found two single bedroom villas for us.   Both upstairs.  No wash cloths.  Not very clean. But we were promised that we would have a 3…

title: Not bad for the price
review: Stayed at Ditka's over the holidays with brother and his family. They had a 3 bedroom unit in building 13; the wife and I had a 1 bedroom in builing 4. Brother is from Chicago; my wife and I lve in Tampa and have Disney annual passes and get to Disney once a month. We typically stay on property, and so were dubious about staying off site at a non-national brand facility. brother stayed for 7 nightsd; I stayed for 2 nights. Overall, not a bad resort. These are basically apartments/condos with full kitchens. Appliances, dinnerware and pots/pans apparently vary by unit or building. Units in various stages of cleanliness. Our couch was stained in several places, brother's unit very clean. Units were very reasonably priced - our one bedroom with AAA rate was about $75 per night,…

title: downgrade in progress
review: We stayed at this place several times. During this visit we had to learn that they are downgrading in service. No more free morning coffee in the lobby and no more room service at all. Hovever you can have your trash emptied and towels exchanged for $15 a day. Add another $10 if you would like to have your bed made. Basically that was included in your room rate earlier. Just don't be disappointed if you have stayed there before.  Location and appearance of the property are still ok. It's conveniently located in the Kissimmee area.

title: Great place to stay, bring your own supplies.
review: Loved it! Beautiful place with full kitchen and everything u need to cook, except food & supplies. Great place for the price! Can't wait to go back!

title: This is a very nice resort and would recommend to people with a family.
review: This is a very nice resort for people with kids.  They have a great pool for kids and then another that adults can relax at.  A nice outside bar and patio area with lots of lunge chairs.    They also have an indoor basketball court and great work out center.  The reception area is nice and the check in is easy and quick.  They only thing I would fore warn - you need to bring your own dishwashing, dishwasher  and laundrydetergent, papertowels (some resorts have these in the rooms).  The rooms are spacious and clean (we were upgraded to a 3 bedroom with loft).

title: Extended stay in your home away from home
review: I had the great pleasure of staying at the Mike Ditka Resort for 6 weeks this summer.  My condo was upstairs and featured a very large living room with 2 sofas, a big screen tv, a full kitchen with sink, dishwasher, oven, stove top, full size refrigerator, tons of cupboard storage space, a counter with barstools, and table with 4 chairs.  There were 2 bedrooms in my condo, but there are larger condos on the property as well.  The master bedroom comes with a king size bed, tv, chair, dresser, walk in closet and full bathroom.  The other bedroom comes with 1 full bed and 1 twin bed, tv, dresser, smaller walk in closet.  Every room has a ceiling fan to accompany the lovely air conditioning already provided.  There is a second bathroom across the hall with a bathtub/shower, toilet…

title: Great value for a condo rental in Orlando!
review: This is not a hotel it's a condo.  They don't do daily cleanings in condos and you don't have the same interaction with the staff that you would in a regular hotel.  They do cleanings on the 4th day of a stay or you can pay extra for different services.  All of this was very clearly explained on check in.  They also provided detergent and dryer sheets for if we wanted to wash our towels ourselves in between times.   The condo was clean - certainly cleaner than the major hotel we had stayed in the night before.  We had plenty of towels and the kitchen equipment was what you would expect if you have stayed at a rental cabin or condo. Definitely not a standard set of anything but enough to make do.  The 1500 sq ft was a lifesaver on one of the nights the park closed early.  We had…

title: Great value, Very clean, Very Pleased
review: We just returned from a Disney trip last week. We stay At Mike Ditka's Runaway Beach club for 6 days.  I seldom write reviews, but had to for the amazing value that this place offered. Everything was clean and the place was spacious. We had proper kitchenware, coffee maker, towels, soap, etc. We will definitely be staying here when we return to Disney again.

title: RUNAWAY - Run as fast as you can away from here
review: This Resort is NOT a resort. It is run by young and inexperienced people. They have no customer service and no consideration for their guest. The rooms look clean on the surface however they are discusting. They DO not clean the rooms daily and don’t clean them properly when you check out, before new guest arrive. I have stayed here a few times giving it a 2nd even a 3rd chance. However 3 strikes and they are out. Mike Ditka only lends his name to this place he does not own it. IF you get the first floor you will surely hear your upstairs neighbor every step they make. The bathrooms have mold. The couches are stained and the carpet is old. The kitchen is a nice feature however there are no cooking supplies or proper utensils. I warn you DO NOT STAY HERE. You will be disappointed.

title: DON'T STAY HERE
review: After almost 2 years of staying in the Mike Ditka resort and enjoying it. They have changed there policy's and there staff is young and rude, This is no longer a nice resort to stay at it has become A CHEAP MOTEL,  They do not offer Cleaning services and upon checking you are luck if they assign you a room that has been cleaned. After being assigned a room that was not cleaned they moved us to one that appeared on the surface to be clean however in the morning when the sun came up, We noticed mold, and cracks in the bath tub, the shower curtain had brown spots.   Regardless how many nights you stay if you run out of toilet paper you are required to run to walmart and replenish it yourself. You are required to wash your towels and they will charge you 15.00 if you want to trade…

title: Second stay, will stay again!
review: This is the second time me and my husband have stayed at the Runaway Beach Club. The first time was in 2006 when we booked directly through the resort, and this time we booked it through VRBO.com (Vacation Rentals By Owner). The owner of this unit (1bed/1bath VRBO#306986) was incredibly helpful and accommodating in getting us settled and making sure all was good. The unit is managed by Kissimmee based Magical Memories. We needed the security bar on the door to be replaced when we moved in, as it was broken, and this was seen to in less than an hour after making the call.  The unit itself is spotless, has two flat screen LCD's and washer/dryer. The king bed in the bedroom is amazingly comfortable and there is also two queen size sofa beds in the living room (if you don't mind…

title: I would have to say i'd definity  comeback to this resort!
review: Excellent stay! nearby walmart, nearby restaurants,close to 192 is where all the nearby  places to eat & shop & enjoy a walk as well. Love the stay!

title: General Manager, Tatiana was reasonable and understanding, on a hot night.
review: The air conditoner compressor broke on our second night staying at the resort.  The management was very understanding, and did everything possible to try to correct the problems. We were moved into another accomadations with a working AC. GM, Tatiane Vanvelzor, went so far as to refund one night of our 3 night stay. The resort itself is beautiful, the rest of the facility is very nice, unfortunately the AC went out at the very worst time of the year, with a heat index above 100, but I guess that could happen anywhere.

title: Beautifully furnished, spacious luxury condos near Disney for price of discount hotel room.
review: We hadn't planned on visiting Disney when we went to Florida to visit our grandchildren, and were a little apprehensive upon finding Mike Ditka's Runaway Beach Club condominiums for only $67 a night.  Especially since we had made a last minute trip to Orlando previously and were less than satisfied with our accomodations, but the kids really wanted to go, so we decided to take the chance anyway.    To say we were pleasantly surprised is truely an understatement.  The entire gated complex is well maintained, spotlessly clean and nicely landscaped.  We were able to park right outside our beautifully furnished 1 bedroom condominium, which is also far more spacious than we expected. With not just 1, but 2 queen sized sofabeds, along with an extremely comfortable king sized bed for…

title: wonderful stay
review: we stayed here for a week, and had a great time.  The king size bedroom and living room with two pull out sofas were great.  The whole place was very clean, the kitchen had nice granite counter tops.  The full washer and dryer were great also.  The pools were nice and clean!! Just watch out for the $10.00 per day fee for using their pool etc.

title: Not here!!
review: We didn't even have soap for the bathroom or kitchen. Disgusting! And they didn't have any in the resort-we asked. Told new management took away to save money. Kitchen didn't even have hotpads. No spatula or spoon for pans; no dish towel or washcloths in the whole condo. Took 4 times to book the resort-put on hold each time. Should have been our first clue. Took 30 minutes to check in as the same 2 gals doing all the checkins were also in charge of the phone reservations. Average place. Very frustrating. Have stayed in much much nicer resorts and fully stocked and my safety(soap) came first. Would not recommend at all!!

title: Very Good Place. Enjoyed the stay
review: I like many read the reviews. The place we had was really nice.  it was clean, affordable, & quite nice.  We found the staff nice & pleasant. We got towels when needed. The room was decorated nice & clean. Pool & Tiki bar was really nice. Great location.  If you’re going with the family, you can cut down the cost & stay here. They give you a kitchen with all utensils so, many meals can be planned & eaten at "home".  If you want they do offer daily maid service. We did not take it.   The Gym is small with limited equipment. It's not that bad but, hey, your not home!  I would DEFINITLY stay here again.

title: Run as fast as you can!!!!
review: We are here through Get Travel for Challenge Sports, Disney Soccer Nationals 3v3 and chose this resort from a couple choices (2 br w/loft).  We got a kitchen that was unstocked, no large pot, only 3 spoons, no serving bowl to make salad, etc.   When front desk contacted it was pretty much 'too bad"!  Second night AC died & after 3 calls to complain someone came out, did something and 2 hours later cooled down.  3rd day after being in sun hours (heat index 102), back ttoroom & no AC, compressor shot, moved to smaller accommodations & no AC again!!  Same "too bad"!!  Unprofessional staff!!

title: Great Place, will stay again!
review: Stayed here with my husband and kids on our Disney World trip and it was excellent!        I gave it a four star as I feel one of the ladies at the reception desk could do a better job with guests. I highly recommend it if you are looking for a fun, clean place to stay, an added plus is that it is close to Disney world and all the other attractions.

title: Our Favorite
review: For the past few years we've spent our Disney trip at Ditka's. Going to Disney World can be super expensive. But we save so much on food and hotel by staying here. We have not found a location in the Disney World area where you can spend so little for such great accommodations. We love great restaurants, but  get tired of eating out and like to prepare our own food, at least some of the time. It's exactly like a small, fully furnished apartment, from full kitchen with pots and pans to washer and dryer  in your room. The housekeeping is light, so you will have to pick up after yourself.  Request a room on the first floor. There are no elevators in the two story buildings and it's a bummer trying to carry luggage up to the second floor. After a long day at Disney who feels like…

title: You Get What You Pay For
review: Have never stayed here before but picked up a super deal online for it. When we got there the room was gorgeous, it was great having a full kitchen with cookware and also a full washer and dryer right inside. The place was clean, no noticeable next room noise carryover, air conditioning worked and was very comfortable and roomy. However some of the amenties stated online were not in effect at all anymore. They had poolside movies which I thought sounded neat but were not provided at all during our stay, as well as no movies for rent at front desk, no daily paper, and housekeeping was intermittent. Housekeeping didn't bother me because I usually clean anyway and we got clean towels about halfway thru stay.  The shuttle service was nice to have and they gave 3 times to choose from…

title: A Complete Disappointment
review: First of all calling this place a resort is a complete fabrication of the truth.  This is an old apartment complex that they converted into a hotel.  Here are the things we liked about our stay:  the proximity to Disney and a WalMart grocery store.  Here are the things we did not like about our stay:    1. The air conditioning barely worked at all.  Since it is very hot in Florida in June it was extremely uncomfortable. 2.  The staff was non responsive to our requests for towels, maid service or maintenance on the air conditioning unit.  No manager was ever available to assist us no matter what time of day we asked. 3.  The walls are paper thin and you can hear every step the guests in the unit above/next to you take. 4.  The units are filthy, especially the bathrooms.  The…

title: Would never stay there again!
review: My family and I stayed at the resort in 2008, and absolutely loved it.  No complaints at all - recommmended it to everyone we knew.  Well, this stay was much, much different!  What a disappointment!  There we so many issues, but here are the highlights -  We were there for five nights, and had to call DAILY for clean towels.  Housekeeping would come in and remove the dirty towels, and not replace any!  We had NO pots, pans, etc in the kitchen.  (We did have plates, bowls & cups)  Fuses were blowing.  The lawn crew was outside of our window at 8:15 in the morning, waking everyone up!  My daughter's hair got caught in their wall-mounted hairdryer because the screen that covers the fan was missing (Lots of screamin and crying!)  Our "apartment" was consistently at 79 - 80 degrees -…

title: Not a bad place to stay
review: My family and I stayed at Runaway Beach Club for a second time the week of June 14th.  Our first visit was in December 2007.  I had not intention of staying at the resort because of some the reviews I had read.  After a mix up with our reservation at another resort, we decided to try this resort.  Although there is some room for improvement, the resort is not a bad place to stay.  Richard at the front desk helped us out a great deal.  Danielle also was very helpful when we decided to extend our stay for two more nights.    One of the chairs in the bedroom could have used a good cleaning and the carpet could be laid out better.   But overall, our experience was great.  Resort fee:  They told us when we arrived that there was a fee, so it was not a shock.  Also, if you do your…

title: Ditka's is my family's choice of hotel from now on
review: Back in January, 2010, my family and I began to put together plans for a 10 day vacation in the Orlando / Daytona Beach area of Florida.  Since there were two distinct familiy groups involved, I first researched hotels with 2 adjoining rooms.  Based on the per room cost, we found this to be quite expensive for a 10 day stay.  Next, I looked at suite/resort offerings and went through the www.tripadvisor.com comments for the best property.  Ditka's Runaway Resort consistently displayed with great ratings.  When I went to the website to check on availability for the period 6/12 through 6/22, I found the rates to be excellent.  I immediately reserved these dates with the resort and counted the days until our vacation would begin.  What a pleasant surprise when we got in late from…

title: This Hotel/Villa is really nice
review: Its one of the best places that I have stayed in as far as hotels. The check in was quick the apartments are spacious and comforting. You can cook, wash your clothes and watch tv as if you were at home. Its close to all of the attractions and has a nice pool, jacuzzi and everything at a walking distance from your apartment. They also have a nice gym where you can do some basic workouts and its not to far from the pool. They have a little of everything in this hotel its a great getaway from everyone and everything.

title: Great family place to stay, very disappointed with service on 2nd visit
review: Our family group of 6 adults and 7 children were very inconvenienced by not being able to get into our unit until hours after the time promised, because basically the previous occupants had trashed it. We were offered drinks at the bar while we waited, which was appreciated. When we finally got to the lovely loft unit, we had to call housekeeping several times for adequate towels and bedding, as well missing kitchen items. I'm not one to complain but it was disappointing. At checkout these things were mentioned and I was told a manager was not on site, but that I would be called. It didn't happen. I did expect that some even minor discount would be credited to our account for all the inconvenience. It won't happen. When I filled out the guest comment card, addressed to a…

title: STAY VERY FAR AWAY FROM THIS DUMP
review: This resort was the dirtiest place that you can imagine,  carpets were disgusting, couch was filthy and could have had bugs. There were three and a half hand lotions in the bathroom and no shampoo’s. People left a dirty diaper outside on the lawn. This place is minus stars. We left a day early due to the very trashy surroundings. For the price there are much better places to stay around the area. STAY AWAY.

title: Never again at any price!
review: After a long day of traveling we arrived at the resort early in the evening. We were informed that our room was not ready and that it would be an hour or so. Two hours later we were finally checked in. Our room was not at all what we expected. The bathroom was dirty and the fridge was disgusting. We called the front desk and they said they would send someone over. It was the next day before housekeeping arrived. We had several other problems during our stay and at one point in time we asked to speak to the General Manager but, "sorry we don't have one" was the response we received. Also be aware of the daily resort fee.  The only bright spot in our stay were the bartenders at the pool bar, they were friendly, knowledgeable about the surrounding area and professional at all…

title: Horrible- Worst Experience Ever!
review: Stayed here in 2008 - that was a great experience.  So I thought it would be an easy decision to book again for 2010.  However, Easy ended up meaning HORRIBLE!  Evidently, they have a new General Manager and a new company handling the housecleaning.  Awakened at all hours of the night when the staff was entering the garage in our unit.  On top of that, we had an (unwelcomed) 8 am wake up call each morning when staff gathered outside our unit chatting each other up.  Although the windows were closed, it seemed like they were wide open.  I mean come on - the #1 reason to book a room is to get a place to sleep - right?  If you can't sleep, what the heck?  We stayed 9 days/8 nights;  visited the pool 3 times - no clean towels at all.  Room was not clean. Kitchen was not properly…

title: Favourite Home Away From Home
review: This was the first place I stayed at when I went to Florida. I've been to Florida several times now, and this resort has left its impression. Although I have found MANY wonderful hotels/resorts in Florida, nothing compares. The rooms are so beautifully decorated. The colours are soothing, pictures are relaxing, and furniture comfy and equally pleasing to the eyes. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. What's another word for beautiful? Use that as the adjective for the pool area. The cute pastel coloured houses make you feel like you're at home, and parking is literally steps from the door. The Walmart Superstore is a stone's throw away so you can save money and eat healthy by getting groceries there and preparing it in your full kitchen, which is stocked…

title: Great place
review: We arrived around midnight and check-in took less than 5 minutes. We had a 2 bedroom with games loft apartment, which was very spacious and clean. The games room was just a room with a couch and TV - but our boys 4 and 5 years old loved this "our room" where they could keep all their toys spread all over the floor for 2 weeks without being asked to clean it up.  As there are no restaurants, we enjoyed the full kitchen and the Walmart just around the corner so we could do our own breakfast and lunch without having to leave the resort. As the weather has not been that hot this winter/spring the pools also weren't that hot, especially the first couple of days (but not cold!) even though they are heated, but our kids loved them and the really warm hot tub were excellent. After…

title: Nice place ... poor service
review: As other reviewers have said, this was a condominium complex that was converted.  The complex is attractive, quiet, and conveniently located.  It has two pools, a hot tub, an indoor half-court basketball court, and a mid-sized exercise room.  What this facility lacks is a professional service staff.  The current staff is probably best described as annoying and disinterested.

title: Very Dirty, noting worked ... very poor service
review: Unfortunately this is the 2nd time we've stay here. The only reason we stay a 2nd time is because we were with a group of 50+ Cheer competition.  The whole place was very dirty …you don’t even feel clean showering in this place. After our competition we moved to a much better resort.  We usually stay in 5 star resorts when we travel. My rating for this place not even a .25 star.  What a dump

title: We Love This Place, it does not disappoint"
review: This is our second time to stay here. We were so excited to return and it did not disappoint us.   We love the extra large condos that easily sleep and accomodate our entire family of 8 and then 9.  The close proximity to Disney and everything Kissimmee has to offer can not be beat as far as we are concerned.   We were able to use their outdoor gas grill, they supplied the propane, so that we could cook outdoors.  The pool area is fantastic for the kids.  The weather could have been warmer but that is not anyone's fault but Mother Natures.  The overall feeling of the place is just what we need on vacation.  The kids are happy to return home after a long day at Disney.  The kitchen is well equiped.  The use of the washer and dryer right in your unit is a huge plus for a family…

title: Great accomodations for short or long stay.
review: My husband, myself, and our adult daughter stayed in a spacious 1 bedroom condo. It was very clean, newly painted, and the kitchen was fully equipped utensils for cooking full meals. The washer and dryer in the unit were a big plus. We would definitely stay again. This is an incredible value for the price.

title: Filthy
review: The condo's are very large, the grounds are kept very nice and the pool is great.  Other than that, I have nothing nice to say.  The inside of the place was FILTHY!  The carpet was stained terribly, the couches were disgusting (I laid towels down before we sat on them) the kitchen floor was sticky, the pots and pans were useless as they were all burned on the bottoms so you couldn't cook in them, there were two broken glasses in the cupboard (not cracked, actually broken with the pieces missing!), the tubs were black on the bottom, the A/C dial fell into my hand when I tried to turn it off, the microwave blew a fuse every time we used it, we placed our trash outside for pickup and they never came so we woke up to garbage all over the front walk as a racoon got into it during the…

title: nothing to write home about
review: The resort is actually condos that were turned into a resort.  It's nice to have a kitchen so you don't have to spend as much on food but it was dirty and the walls were very thin.

title: With some TLC this place could be a gem
review: Although a little hard to find(impossible without a GPS), once we arrived we were pleasantly surprised by the quaint, pastel coloured houses that were to be our home for the next 8 days.  We rented the 2 bedroom w/loft and games room for 4 adults, hoping to have lots of space for our vacation and had high expectations because Mike Ditka put his name on the place.  The first floor is a small entryway and closet(closet door was broken) big enough for one person followed by a long flight of stairs(especially for the member of our party who recently had knee surgery).  Once you reach the top you enter what at first glance is a very pleasant and spacious 2 bedroom apartment with two full baths and a full size washer and dryer.   Another set of stairs takes you to the loft/games room…

title: Nice place, bad service
review: We booked a stay at this nice condo style hotel complex at the last minute.  When we tried to check in, they refused to allow us in until 4:30.  My elderly parents had to hang out at restaurants waiting and waiting.  The person on the desk was nasty and belligerent.  He seemed to resent the fact that we booked on Expedia, and when we inquired about adding a night (which we did not) he told us we would have to pay double what we were paying and could not call Expedia to book again.  There was no ice on the premises, we were told to go to 7-11 if we wanted it.  No restaurant or facilities except a swimming pool.  We were also charged a non-disclosed ten dollar "facilities fee" when we arrived, although we were told we were fully pre-paid.  Avoid this place.

title: Last Time We Will Stay
review: We stayed January 16th for two nights.  We have stayed here three times in the past and unfortunately, this will be our last visit.  The rooms are large and the price is fairly reasonable, BUT there is just zero customer service going on at this hotel.  We had a refrigerator that made a horrible noise every time the compressor turned off and on.  The entire kitchen rattled and the noise was so loud that it kept us up at night.  I can only imagine what our downstairs neighbors thought.  We told the front desk about the problem and were told maintenance would check into it.  We left around 8:00 a.m. and returned at 5 p.m.  There was no note, no phone message and soon, we found out, nothing had been done to our refrigerator.  So my husband called the front desk and was told that…

title: THE BEST PLACE FOR RELAXATION
review: I choose Mike Ditka Runaway Beach Club after reading many reviews. But I hadn't imagined just how amazing this place was going to be.  It was the most peaceful and relaxing resort. THe holiday season is suppossed to be a busy time but it didn't feel at all crowded and the place was a haven of beauty and calm. It is set out like a pastel coloured chocolate box village with manicured lawns and a goegeous lagoon as the focal point which is overlooked by the deck with sunloungers, also the 2 pools and hot tub.  There is a great kids pool for the little kids and the regular pool as well. There are freshly washed towels by the pool so you use them and leave them in the box provided. It makes things so easy.  There is relaxing music played by the pools, and you can just lie there and…

title: Check the room before you check in!
review: We arrived Dec.30th  for a 2 night stay.  The place looks nice when you drive up but if you plan on staying here take some Febreeze or Oust with you.  I opened the door and it smelled awful.  And it's not FL..I have stayed at other resorts in the area and they didnt smell like this place.  I was told by the front desk that the condos are cleaned between guests but I think all they do is vacuum and change the sheets.  Counters were dirty,  I even went out and bought stuff to spray the tubs because they didnt look clean.  But what did it for me was whe I turned the ceiling fan and dust balls started flying everywhere.  I called the front desk and they said housekeeping would be there the next day to take care of it ..hmmm that never happened.  I even explained to the lady that my…

title: The resort is getting tired, be carefull when booking, unflexible Manager
review: The resort is getting tired, I have stayed here before and loved it. Good location. This time our beds were not very comfortable ( getting old). The kitchen was not well equipped, basics were missing and the coffee maker did not work. I reported this to the front desk who did not take care of it.  Be careful when booking, they have a 72 hour cancellation policy for each night booked.  Because of the beds  we decided to move to a nicer hotel, so I wanted to check out a day early, not usually a problem with any reputable hotel.   When I went to check out the manager told me that he would not refund my money because they require a three day notice. I had already stayed two days at this point. I  told him that I assumed that like most hotels once you check in an early checkout is…

title: Cheap and just OK
review: What I liked: The rooms were nice size. It looks like condos that have been converted into hotels. There is a full kitchen with refrigerator which is nice if you are staying for a while.  What I was not impressed with: The thing that really turned us off was the comforter on our bed was stained. It was an obvious stain that you would think the staff would have either cleaned or not put it on the bed. There were also stains on the walls near the stairs that may have been from luggage. The other bad reviews seem to have had a big issue with this and it is a problem. We got the room at a really good price and the lack of attention to detail in the cleaning staff may be how they offer such nice rooms so cheaply.  They say on their literature that you can get Disney tickets at the…

title: We got More than we expected!
review: We booked a 3 night stay on our way down from Wisconsin through Expedia. We reviewed the pictures on my laptop and everything appeared nice. When we arrived and checked in, I thought there must have been an error in the booking. The LOW price we paid was a HUGE value when my family of 7, yes i said  7of us were treated to a large , clean, fully accomadated and spacious townhome suite. I paid more for a double queen motel room  than I did for our stay here. And to top it off. Wal-mart was 2 blocks from the front gate. We were able to save money buying food, supplies and Disney tickets there. The kids and I had fun in the clean and well maintained pool area to cool off at night. Then it was back to the suite for a movie on the big HDTV widescreen TV. We had a SUPER time at the…

title: Clean, beautiful, new condo for the price of a hotel room!
review: My family stayed here last spring and fell in love with this resort!  They are condos that have been converted to hotel "rooms", and for the price, they can't be beat.  Our "room" included: * 2 flat screen TVs * full kitchen with granite countertops, full sized appliances including dishwasher * all pots & pans, cooking implements, dishes, etc. * dining room table folds out to seat 6 * separate living area, private bedroom * walk-in closet * private patio * roughly 900 SF * washer & dryer  In addition, the room is clean (take it from me, I'm a germophobe!), the staff is friendly, there are 2 pools including a zero depth pool for kids, and it's close to Disney.  We have told everyone we know about this hotel!

title: Great stay and value
review: Family of four stayed for two days in a one bedroom apartment.  Other than the so-so bed, the place was perfect for us.  Everything was very clean and staff was very nice.  This is the best value we have found so far in the Disney area and we will be glad to book again in the future.

title: I don't understand the bad reviews
review: we LOVEd this place.  We had a 2 BR.  It really was more like a townhome community, than a hotel.  I thought the facilities were beautiful and the value was great.

title: Keep looking!!!
review: Appearance of facility is great.  Spacious accomodations.  But it ends there!  The bathroom was not cleaned well.  Both the bathroom tub and kitchen sink were clogged!  The resort was not anywhere near full, but we were put in a unit that was being roofed and other units near us were being remodeled.  There was a family in the unit above us and every step could be heard.  Overall we were disappointed.  The management only offered to give a good deal on our next stay.

title: Stay Elsewhere - Dirty/Neglected Facility!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: We booked a standard unit at an excellent price on Expedia, without housekeeping, for a 4 night stay in mid October 2009.  The location was perfect, close to the parks, shopping, eateries etc and the grounds were meticulously cared for.  The room we booked was dirty and in desperate need of maintenance/ painting.  When we reported the situation to the front desk we were upgraded to a larger room.  Front desk staff reminded us,, that we were indeed given the room we booked  "On Expedia" and should appreciate the upgrade.  OUR EXPECTATION WAS MERELY CLEAN/COMFORABLE AND NOTHING MORE FOR THE PRICE WE PAID!.  The upgraded unit was noticeably cleaner but still not not what would be expected in an average hotel (RESORT???????).  The bedding/linens were the worst I have EVER seen in a…

title: Great place to stay but in need of some TLC
review: We had an overnight stay here in 2007 and were so impressed we were determined to stay for longer on our next visit to Orlando.  So this time I booked a week through Expedia and we had a spacious 3-bed upstairs condo.    There is enough room to swing a dozen cats in these apartments and we could easily lose our three sons for the evening after a busy day at the parks.  The apartments are ideally located for all the theme parks and there's a Wal-Mart within walking distance for grocery needs.  The kitchen is fairly well-equipped (no frying pan for some reason) with the odd bit of cutlery or a glass missing/chipped.  A giant washer and dryer solves all your laundry problems and the beds are comfortable.  However, the Credit Crunch has not been kind to this resort and our apartment…

title: GREAT PLACE FOR A FAMILY VACATION
review: Cannot Beat The Comfort Of Having A Full Sized  Washer And Dryer Inside The Unit.    The Rooms Are Very Nicely Decorated,  Very Spacious And Comfortable And Include A Full Size Kitchen And Extra Tv In The Living Room So The Kids Can Watch Their Own Stuff.....   Only Downside Is Housekeeping Is Not Included,  You Need To Pay Extra.   We Got A Great Discounted Rate So It Wasnt So Bad To Have To Pay For The Housekeeping.   The Kids Pool Is Great,  And You Cant Beat The Location.

title: It Was Fantastic, it is the BEST value in the Disney area!
review: We have stayed at this resort every year for the last five years and it has always been very good, after being able to relax in this 2 bedroom 2 bath 1100 plus square foot unit we can’t ever stay in one of the Disney owned overpriced tiny rooms again, we get this huge unit for less than a standard motel room at a moderate Disney resort.  It's awesome to put the kids down and be able to close the door to their room, put my feet up and watch TV or a movie in the living room plus they offer a shuttle to Disney World, a business center, an indoor basketball court, a fitness center, an adult pool, and a kids pool to die for as well as movies at night out by the pool. This resort is only 2.5 miles from Disney, 2 miles from the Prime 1 outlet center and less than 1 mile from Wal-Mart,…

title: Don't waste your money
review: I payed extra for house keeping and they never did there job. They never left shampoo,dish soap, new kitchen towels, coffee ect... They were so lazy and just threw towels on the floor in the bathroom..didnt put them up on the rack. We acually had to call down to the front desk to ask for more toilet paper because we ran out when the maid was in there a hour before that. If you cant do steps..DONT STAY HERE. right when you walk into your villa you have to walk up like 20 steps..my mom has bad knee's and had such a hard time. I called down to see if we could get switched and he said that Cheaprooms new how there villa layouts were set up and its there fault they didnt tell me..The manager was very rude and did absolutly NOTHING to try and make my stay better. He told me i could…

title: Guard your personal property.  Dismissive, non-responsive management.
review: Our family stayed at the Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club while our 12-year-old daughter participated in a soccer tournament.  Her iPod and digital camera were stolen from her backpack after a Resort employee removed her backpack from the pool area (without her consent) while the pool was open.  The General Manager was very dismissive when we reported the incident, telling us that unless an employee admitted stealing the items, there was nothing the Resort would do.  The Executive Manager told us to file a police report (which we did), and the CEO, Guest Services and other members of management did not return our phone calls or respond to our comment card, e-mails or letters.  No explanation, no apology, no offer to even partially reimburse our daughter for her $300 loss. …

title: Beware this hotel overbooks then cancels confirmed reservations at last minute
review: We made reservations through Expedia for two three bedroom villas, paid in full, and even called to speak to the hotels reservation desk to confirm our booking and was told that they had reserved us villas that were next to each other.  The day before we were to arrive, we got an urgent e mail from Expedia to call. When we did they told us that the hotel had overbooked, and at the last minute had canceled five bookings, including ours. We called the hotel and spoke to the front desk who confirmed what Expedia had told us, with no apology or explanation. As it is a busy holiday period, our plans are ruined, and we are struggling to find alternative accomadation. Stay away from this hotel until they get new management and a new reservation policy.

title: I would never stay here again!
review: I hope to help fellow travelers out by relating my experience at the Mike Ditka Runaway Beach resort.  I checked in at almost 11pm and asked for a quiet room for myself, me being a middle aged lady.  There were several building units with not a single car in front of them, yet they chose to put me in a unit with a few cars in front, which meant they were occupied.  Not a big deal, but why not allow me to stay in a quiet, unrented unit?  Too far for the maids to walk?  I don’t know.  I opened the door to the unit and there was this long stairway- 21 steps up to my living area/bedroom.  Now let me ask you, would you put a 50 year old lady traveling along with 2 heavy suitcases in a room where you have to hand lug your baggage up these steps?  There is no elevator, keep in mind.  I…

title: The place to stay for us - we will definitely be back
review: This is the third time we have stayed here and meets all our expectations. It is not a hotel, although if anything the servicing of the rooms has improved.  Clean, comfortable, quiet, a good location for all the parks and excellent value for money.

title: Good Value, Spacious, Excellent Location
review: You find the usual glitches that come with properties that where individual units are owned by individuals and rented by the management company - inadequate staff, spotty housekeeping, and round treatement by the "guests" that seem to feel that being on vacation means a license to destroy property.   To the good, not too far from WDW maingate, access to plenty of restaurants and touristy shopping, right across from Walmart, which has an amazingly good takeout selection as well as a Redbox dvd rental kiosk, fully and nicely equipped full kitchen with spacious eat-in dining nook, whole lotta square footage very reasonably priced - a pleasant shock after 30 years of on Disney property rooms.  Major outstanding disappointment - the pool area. Too small to accomodate guests, and…

title: I wish I could live here!!
review: This place was absolutely AMAZING!! We stayed here for our honeymoon and it was perfect. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom for free! I loved the kitchen and the washer and dryer. The fact that there is a Wal Mart right down the road is awesome too! We will definately stay here again.

title: Robbed by the Hotel!!!
review: Nice and comfortable hotel for the price.  We chose the "no housekeeping" service, but unfortunately received it.  It wouldn't have been so bad if they would have spent more time cleaning the room than cleaning us out.  Why take kids stuff?  Police report filed, hotel incident report filed, management notified...and nothing.  They even have the door card swipe history.  Management informed me that it wasn't their responsibility.  If you want to save a few bucks, stay here.  You will pay for it later, though. 1SG Lyle, US Army

title: We picked a really winner by staying here!
review: Seven of us (4 adults and 3 children ages 9,10,11) spent a short but "SUHWEET!" one nighter at Ditka's Resorts Runaway Beach Club following a fun but exhausting Disney Cruise and a surprise last vacation day at Universal for our boys this past spring break in April.  I'd found and reserved the resort online and since I only had online information and picturess to rely on (which can sometimes be misleading), I called the resort's front desk several times before our trip for reassurance that I'd made a good choice for our stay.  Each time I called, I spoke with "ubber" friendly staff who eagerly answered ALL of my questions in a very professional and helpful manner!  Still, the price for the quality we were paying for seemed too good to be true, so as our trip's planner, I…

title: Love it!! Best home away from home!
review: This place is awesome!! I can never ever stay in a regular hotel room again after having the luxury of room in this place!! Perfect for bug families! I took my three children there to celebrate my Daughters Birthday. We had the most amazing time!! The resort is beautiful and very accomidating. It was conviently located to many stores, Resturants and the theme parks. We spent a very memorable morning at your resort, with a coffee cake w/ candles for my 4 year olds Birthday. We sang, ate, and opened presents at our mini party befroe hitting Disney for the day. I love this resort because it is clean, comfortable, very roomy, and has all the comforts of being at home. We will for sure be back to celebrate many more Birthdays in the future. I will recommend your place to everyone I…

title: Serene & Fun-Filled Home-Away-From-Home in the Disney Area - www.runawaybeachhotel.com,  [- -]
review: It is with the utmost honor and sincere pleasure that our family forward this “praise report” of the outstanding professional service and warm hospitality received from the entire staff at Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club.  The peaceful “home-away-from-home” atmosphere was so addictive that after we relocated to a popular Disney resort for 2 nights, our children literally begged to return to the quiet serenity, as they longed to continue relaxing around the pool and pond areas which both echoed the meditative trinkling of their water fountains.  Our family really appreciated the resort’s careful attention to all the details that made our stay stress-free, such as “Dive-In” movies around the pool at night, a Playstation with video games, DVD movies, separate children’s pool…

title: I wouldn't be paid to stay here again
review: If I could rate this hotel's service a 0, I would.  Recently myself and my youth group attended a church competition in Orlando, Fl. We are from Tampa and traveled to Orlando to stay for a couple of days. Our Pastor booked this hotel for an excellent rate of $99 a room, per night. We had two, two-bedroom villas, for two nights. The total came to a little over $400. It was a great price. After staying there, I now understand why it was so cheap.   The rooms were nice, spacious and fairly comfortable. Some of the beds weren't fantastic, but it wasn't unbearable. The first thing I noticed was that the guy who was working the front desk could not have been more than 22 years old. So I figured it was just a family type business and brushed it aside because he was very friendly. Later…

title: Can someone help me please or can someone at the front desk care
review: Took a gamble wanted my kids to have a nice getaway in a tough recession. First of  all, the front entrance gate was stuck most of the weekend.  Upon stopping at the front desk no one seemed happy we spent money to stay at there resort during a recession. No map, no mention of resort activities,  no checklist of hotel amenities  and most of all no great customer service.The male bathroom in the lobby was filthy. Upon entering the villa I requested  several  times kitchen utensils; frying pan, dish cloths, spatula and no mittens. The kitchen utensils arrived after I confronted the manager  about the lousy service. The refrigerator ice machine never worked. Just terrible and I spent money for this!!!!!!!!!

title: Terrible customer Service
review: While the room is wonderful, large and clean the service and the staff are terrible. There are never any towels at the pool and when you ask for more they never show up. Our VCR would not work and we called for directions on how the get it to work and they told us "how hard is it to work a VCR".  The front desk staff truly does not care if you are there or not, so do yourself a favor and stay where someone cares about your business.

title: The best family place to stay - Thank you again for the best time of our lives!!
review: This is the best suggested place to stay for family in my opinion. This was our 2nd time visitng the resort and I can honestly say that we were very impresed with the overall stay and very impressed with all the staff that works there. Everyone is always very friendly and you can even check out as late as noon. My children are always excited when they hear they are going and you don't even need to go anywhere because you have everything you need at the resort. They supply all the necessary equipment in the kitchen so you can take your own food and cook. My children are only 10 and 11 and they are just as happy hanging out at the resort. The pool is always warm and they have a hot tub. They have shaded areas so you don't have to sit and in the direct heat. you can sit back and…

title: DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY FOR DEPOSIT
review: Made a reservation May 2008 for a 8 day vacation for March 2009 and gave them a $200  deposit.  Had to cancell my vacation and was told that the deposit was credited to my Visa.  I have a cancellation number and have talked to accounting and many managers and still do not have a credit.  I don't know what to do next!  DO NOT GIVE THIS RESORT ANY MONEY!!!

title: Clean and great value with a lot of space - good deal for sports teams
review: We stayed here for 3 nights with a sports team, so reserved six two-bedroom villas.  I was a bit worried due to some of the reviews but didn't experience anything negative. Check-in was easy (used reduced rate on expedia) as was check-out.  The rooms were clean and attractive, and we especially appreciated  the washer and dryer (as well as the 3 separate tv's in each villa).  It was convenient to drive to shopping and restaurants (none were within walking distance).  Pools seemed smaller than the photos on the website but were kept clean and the indoor (air conditioned) basketball court was heavily used by the kids.  The beds seemed very comfortable and the large bathroom in the king bed suite was wonderful.

title: Great price, poor service, would not stay there again
review: In 24 hours we saw a cockroach in the bath, have called the front office because the AC didn't work, the TV didn't work,  and we didn't have any dishwasher soap.

title: Excellent location near Disneyland
review: I was at the Mike Ditka's Runaway beach resort with my co-workers from the workplace and absolutely had a great time in Orlando-Kissimee. They did a smooth 15 minute check-in at 3 AM in the morning after we drove in from Atlanta,GA. The resort itself is very convenoently located close to Disney parks and i would recommend this especially for a small group as the villa-apartment type units come with a fully equipped kitchen, big screen television, good climate control(air conditioning) ample parking space and socializing areas within one's own apartment. House keeping has scope for improvement as it was really some wait before we could get the utensils cleaned and the beds made again. We were a group of 5 friends and had a good time there. The resort has an excellent poolside…

title: Unexpected Delight
review: We stayed here on our last night at Disneyworld.  We were exhausted and needed to stay close to Disneyworld but out of the park.  We were very unsure when we first arrived on what to expect.  We were very pleasantly surprised.  The front desk  staff were very friendly but definitely had a hard time finding our reservation and after several minutes they finally gave us key cards to a nice little house.  As soon as we got to the house it started sprinkling and they key cards would not work to let us in.  We went back to the front desk and they gave us new cards to try and they still didn't work.  Meanwhile we are getting rained on.  Finally they volunteered to upgrade us from a two bedroom to a three bedroom at no extra cost with a playstation  and loft with gameroom for the kids.…

title: We found the service extremely poor
review: First I must list the things we liked: location was great, check in and out was quick and pleasant and the rates we got through Hotels.com was compatiable.  However the things we found during our 4 day stay make it unpleasent.  We got in late so we didn't notice until the next morning that the coffee maker was broken and so was the ice machine. The beds make lots of noise which made it impossible to get a good night sleep  and the pillows were small also  the linen didn't smell fresh.  One of the toilets was sluggish in flushing, one remote control would not work and one was missing. The bathtub had no non slipping tapes on it and it was slippery on getting in and out. When we got up the next morning the ice maker had overflowed over and there was water on the kitchen and on the…

title: What a joke
review: I could have stayed at a red roof inn and paid alot less. Just checked out today 5-25-09. I got a 1 bedroom place with no a/c and the fan was so loud I couldn't run it. The microwave didn't work and my son ended up with PINK EYE for the sheets/pillow. Don't waste your money this place is a dump. At checked I didn't understand my bill and the guy at the desk goes I don't understand it either, Online I thought I was paying 110 a night it turned out to be 195 a night and nothing worked. I'm in South Florida and travel to Orlando alot and this is the first time and last time staying at this place please please people don't waste your money. I have a kid with pink eye because of this stay. Talk about a worthless resort they don't even have a place to eat there.

title: Not a value without good customer service
review: This 'hotel' has beautiful grounds and the location isn't too far from Disney and other attractions.  Our problem is with the lack of attention to detail with the front desk staff on down to housekeeping.  When housekeeping did show up, it was very late in the day (anywhere from 3:30 to 6 p.m.) after we had spent a full day away from the unit. Sometimes they brought new towels but they didn't bring washcloths for 2 days. We complained to the front desk and, after being bounced around from them to housekeeping and then to the manager's voice mail, we got an 'oh well, sorry, we'll look into it' attitude.  Another issue we had was with the lack of security. A day after checking in, my key card did not work. I went to the front desk and, without checking my i.d., they simply handed…

title: Poorly managed, unresponsive to guests needs, no one in charge
review: We arrived at 11:30.  Check in was 4.  Although we rented 3 units for 4 nights, they couldn't manage to clean up a single 1 bedroom unit.  We checked in at 4:30.  I asked for a public bathroom in the lobby.  There was 4 inches of water on the floor.  The receptionist smiled and said she knew about it.  I told her then she should have it mopped up and a sign warning people of the wet floor.  We had a Fed Ex delivery sent to us.  Although the staff signed for it, they couldn't find it the next day until after we'd already left for the parks.  Park tickets were enclosed.  Check in was inefficient and time consuming.  Clean up consists of spreading out the blanket on top of the bed and fresh towels.  It takes under 5 min. per unit.  This was done at 5:40 P.M.  Why bother at all, at…

title: Some good, some bad.
review: We did arrive about 30 minutes prior to check-in time, so I was expecting to have to wait a little bit, and they told me the room was not ready and that it should be ready within an hour.  That was no problem, and my entire family was starving anyway.  We went to eat and returned to the hotel about 2 hours later.  The two people working the front desk were very nice, but also very overwhelmed with the phone ringing off the hook and with the other 2 people on line waiting for their room.  Long story short, I waited at the front desk for another 45 mins until the room was ready.  I can't be sure, but it seemed they overbooked, and from the whispering I heard between the workers, it sounded like the two people on line behind me who were waiting for their reserved rooms (same room…

title: Great Value - Rooms need some Renovations
review: My wife and I booked a 3 BR with loft for 5 adults and 1 child. When we checked in, we discovered that our original room was TOO HOT. The temp on the thermostat said 85 degrees. We were moved to a regular 3 BR on the first floor. It was wonderful, cool, fairly clean, and conveniently located close to the pool. But since there are many kids that stay here, a 1st floor unit is noisier than a 2nd floor one. The only time it was a problem was around 11pm, when the movie at the pool let out and the teens rushed up the stairs making noises. On the PLUS side, there is a kitchen with stove, fridge, microwave. For only $180/nite, you can have at least 6 people stay in the 3BR unit. That is a GREAT deal compared to traditional hotels. On the MINUS side, when you don't stay at Disney, you…

title: Good value but not as nice as other places in the area
review: This place is a good value, but they lack the attention to detail.  Our room was a second floor room.  You walk in the door and the stairs to go up are right in front of you.  I didn't really care for that - since I had a 2 year old with me.  So, at night we blocked the stairs with the chairs from the dining room.  Our couch had a stain on the cushion, I just flipped it over so we didn't have to see it.  And the molding around the front door was rotting away.  We also had a broke tile in the entrance way.  We have stayed at MUCH nicer places in the area for a little bit more.  I do know people that have stayed her that really liked it.  Maybe they just never stayed anywhere nicer and have nothing to compare it to.

title: Don't expect to have your reservation actually work!
review: Despite having made arrangements in advance and then calling ahead to confirm our late arrival, our two-bedroom condo had been given away and our credit card charged. Our family of six was stuffed into a one bedroom condo.  Unsat.

title: First stay was great, Second changed my opinion
review: My self, spouse and son stayed here about a year ago, on the second floor.  Apparently this is the key, whenever I see great reviews I wonder where their unit was.  This time we stayed on the first floor.  Walls and ceiling are paper thin, so much so that I actually woke in the middle of the night thinking that someone was in our living room having a conversation when it was actually the people above us.  They were not being excpetionally loud either.   This happened both nights we were there after midnight when they returned from their days activities, good thing they were not revealing any personal information because I could hear them so well, it was like I was sitting there with them.  The resort appearance is very nice, with a great pool, clean rooms and a great location,…

title: Convenient for those looking for a home away for home with a great value!
review: My husband and I came to the Orlando area to visit relatives and were looking for a convenient place to call our home for 6 days and 5 nights.  We spent two weeks looking for the perfect place that wouldn't be over crowded nor have small rooms.  I had never stayed in a condo before so this was our first adventure.  When we arrived we were greeted with the friendly staff who, in under 5 minutes, had us checked into our room and given us our keys.  Our condo was in building 11 and was a 1 bedroom, 1 bath upstairs.  It was great to have our own private entrance with a staircase, along with a full kitchen with washer & dryer, dining and living room with TV and pullout sofa, and a huge bedroom with a walk in closet and large bathroom.  We even had a doorbell and newspaper delivered…

title: simply the best
review: we had agreat time in your beach club we stayed at runnaway beach club in kissimmee fl. and it was more than we expected it was beautiful and our stay was great.

title: Lots of space to stretch out
review: We loved it.  I went with my family, 4 kids and we loved having the extra space.  Full kitchen, 2 bathrooms and lots of room to relax.  Great Pool and play area.  Our kids quickly met friends poolside and looked forward to getting back to the hotel just as much as they enjoyed Disney World, so mom and dad got lots of R&R as well.          This resort is close to the airport and very close to the parks.  Walking distance to a full service Walmart.  Lots of restaurants very very close by.   If you are not driving I do recommend renting a car.  It is not much more than the cost of the shuttle and it adds so much flexibility to your trip

title: Its a nice place to live...
review: The place was super...we liiked every minute there and it was close to all attractions and the SuperWalmart. So we were able to relax at our place and do our own cooking.....after a nice SPA. If I can say something wrong, it's that we just stayed there for a week...!!!! Not long enough. And my recommandation is that you should rent a car just like we did.

title: It was like a home away from home - But only BETTER!
review: We did a ton or research on different places in the Disney area before making a reservation.  We have been to Florida quite a few times and have always been feeling like our accomodations lacked in one way or another.  I found this place on the internet and went to many different sites to read the reviews and check out the pictures.  We finally decided that this was the one for us.    Talk about a great decision!  We couldn't have been more thrilled.  The staff that greeted us were friendly and very helpful.  We were checked in within minutes and when we got to our Villa, we were enchanted by the adorable "neighborhood".  There was tond of parking and everyday we were able to park right outside our door without issue.  The place has a security gate so only peple staying there…

title: Not worth it.
review: My husband had a weeklong conference in Orlando, so we took the kids out of preschool and came to sunny Florida from the snowy north.  This timeshare property is pretty and the location, a block away from an entrance to the Oceola Parkway (which gets you to Disney World in about 5 minutes) can't be beat.  The units themselves could use some TLC, however.    We stayed in a three-bedroom, two bath unit, on the ground floor.  Let me warn you, if you have small children or light sleepers, this is not the place for you.  The walls (and ceilings) are paper thin.  Some of the units have video game systems included and we were entertained by the young girls upstairs, singing until the wee hours of the morning.    There is a full sized kitchen, but we had to buy a frying pan to fix eggs…

title: Filthy and poor customer service---stay away!!!
review: My wife and I just stayed for one night, thank God!!!  I had called hotel the night before our arrival and requested an early check in, I was told no problem. We arrived later than I had asked and room was still not ready, I was told there was NO way anyone could have told me that on the phone and I should call or come back in 2 hours (so I was accused of lying in a nice way).  So I called and they said room was STILL not ready so they would "upgrade" us to a larger room that WAS ready upon the initial arrival. So we went back and checked in. The resort looked very nice at first glance but the closer you looked you could tell the property was not very well maintained. The room we had was a 2 bedroom condo with a loft. It was very large but thats all it had going for it. There…

title: Great Value, Cute Decore, Great for Families, But Some Cleanliness Issues
review: Great for families!  If your going to stay for a week or two with the kids, book this one.  It has a time share feel to it.  We did not check out the pools, no time.  The style is a relaxing beachy feel.  The price was great for what we got!  It felt like we were staying in someone's home, cozy!  The downfalls:  there was lack of attention to details that would would find in a nicer resort.  Like lightbulbs that were out.  A lamp did not work at all.  The carpet needs to be replaced.  The front entrance way was filthy!  These would be easy to overlook if kids were there.  Would not recommend  for a romantic get away.  Overall I would still recommend it!  Warning:  it's adjacent to a highway that requires tolls on and off (coins only with not person, so bring the change bucket).

title: $74 Good Value Roomy 1 Bedroom Condo Would Recommend
review: My husband and I recently stayed here for 2 days.  I found the accomodations very acceptable. We booked a 1 bedroom unit for $74.  The unit had a large living room big enough for 2 full size sofas a large coffee table and a tv.  It had a full size kitchen with granite countertops. The kitchen wasn't big but adequate. The bedroom was a good size with a big walk in closet. Good to have for long term stay.  The bathroom was a really good size.  Plenty of room if bathing several little one's at one time. For the same price of a hotel room we had our own apartment.  It also had a washer and dryer right in the unit.  AWesome if we would have been staying longer. TIP: Our unit was 1 away from the registration desk. One thing to note is that from the outside of the unit it looks like it…

title: Good for the price
review: I booked through Jet Blue and first booked at Mike Ditka's Lighthouse Key Resort...little did I know they can change reservations.  Didn't like that aspect, since I rec'd an email stating they no longer could provide a suite for my family of 5 but offered one at Runaway.  When I called to confirm, it was a bit cheaper and they refunded the difference.  I wanted to know if they had cribs, washers, etc...and the woman at the desk seemed bothered and annoyed, and could not offer me any specific info.  I called Management, which did get back to me right away, said he'd upgrade my room, have a gift waiting (which I did not want, just wanted to make sure hotel was clean, a 4 star like Lighthouse, which it isn't, it's a 3 star).  Anyway, upon checking in, there was no upgrade, and we…

title: The Steggall Family's Review
review: Very clean, comfortable and has plenty of room for the 6 of us (2 bedded loft included). Convenient and less than a mile from supermarket (Wallmart) and many restaurants (including Ponderosa buffet breakfast at the end of the road).   The only problem was that it was hard to find; poorly signed from the  road.   Very nice stay and good value for money.

title: Cute Resort, well stock rooms!
review: The rooms were very clean and cozy! They seemed liked condos and had a full kitchen with everything needed for eating, cooking. The bed in the room was comfortable although i only layed on it once as i got the pull out sleeper sofa. The pull out sofa is the worst i've ever slept on and hurt me a bit. The TVs are nice however and overall i was happy with the rooms. The pool area is laid out well with lounge chairs around the pool as well as on a sundeck. Music is piped in and creates a relaxing island atmosphere! There were FAR too many children though (yes, i know it is disney area) and i didn't stay in the pool for long during the day time. The staff was friendly enough though they seemed unconcerned with guest questions or requests.   Overall the rooms were above average and i…

title: Awesome
review: We stayed here from October 17 to 31 and it was absolutely amazing.
