I went with my girlfriend, my parents, my aunt and my 7 year old cousin and everyone of us loved it so it is great for everyone.  We had a three bedroom villa, house 204 in building 8 and it was a perfect base camp.  The staff were helpful and friendly and the only downside was that there was no bar or restaurant on site.  Only a 20 min walk from sharky's sports bar as well, where it was $3 for a double vodka and red bull (being from the UK where that would cost around £6/$11) I was in heaven.  I hope to revisit again soon.

title: Our second time around was even better.
review: We stayed here last month (October, 2008) for vacation.  We liked it so much, that since we had to return to the area for business in November - we chose to stay here again.    Sure, its not 5 star acomodations.  But they don't claim to be and you don't pay like if it were.  What you do get is a fast check in experience.  Staff is service oriented.  The place is clean.  The pool area is beautifull and relaxing.  Convenient to all atractions and shopping venues.    Quick experience:  Our dryer stoped working one night late.  The next morning they sent someone who replaced the entire machine in 20 minutes.    My only complain is that there is no Bar or Restaurant on the premises.  A Bar at the pool would be great.  We asked management about it and we were told that its in future…

title: Very good Stay
review: We stayed at Runaway Beach Club the first week in November. We stayed there the previous year the same week, we even chose to stay in the same 2 bedrm, second floor unit, which my kids thought was a cool idea. We were totally pleased last year, and I am happy to report it was very good this year. The unit shows a bit of wear, and the AC return grille needed a good vacuuming  but otherwise it was the same. The location is great and very convenient to fast shopping for food. This is not a resort, it has a nice pool and deck area (which we didnt even visit this year), but not alot going on which we like, it is quiet and relaxing after a day at the parks. We eat breakfast and some dinners in the unit depending on how exhausted we are. My 2 boys 6 and 10 are happy to return from the…

title: Good Value, Becoming a Little Run Down
review: We stayed at the resort from Nov 1 - Nov 8.  This was our second stay at the hotel this year.  Our first visit was for a week in Feb.  We did notice some changes from our first visit to this visit.  Location - the hotel is about 4-5 miles from Disney.  Not a big deal for us as we weren't really going to the parks that often.  There is a shuttle that can be taken from the Courtyard hotel across the street.  It makes 3 trips to Epcot daily and then you would have to take the Disney transport to get around.  There is a 24 hour Walmart and 24 hour Target nearby for groceries.  There is sufficient dining options in the surrounding area for those who are eating out.  Check-in - we arrived at 1am and the desk clerk greeted us warmly and had us on our way in minutes.  We had the same…

title: Wonderful accomodation and location
review: We have just returned from a 2 week stay and must say that the accomodation and location of the apartments exceeded our expectations. We had a first floor apartment whcih we found to be huge, very clean and comfortable and had all the facilities that we required.  On booking in we found the reception staff very helpful and polite. The landscaping and pool complexes were very impressive and we would recommend the apartments to anyone and we will certainly be returning here in a couple of years time.

title: Nice Stay
review: My family and I stayed her for a long weekend this past October when we were visiting Disney.  It was only about 10 minutes away from Disney.  The area was nice.  The pool area and deck were very nice for families.  The pool towels were quite small so you may want to bring your own.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite with 4 of us and it was plenty big enough.  We requested a second floor suite because of noise, however, there was none to worry about, very quite. The second floor rooms have no balcony though, the first floor have small patios.  The rooms were quite large compared to Disney resort rooms but they are older so they were a little worn down.  The kitchen was nice with all major appliances.  There was no frying pan so we went to Walmart and just bought one.  The Walmart…

title: Not a "RESORT" at all!!
review: I stayed at the "resort" over the past weekend and I would not recommend it at all.   We stayed in the loft type room. Main issues:  - There is no restaurant on property.  When you have hungry kids at the pool you have to get in the car and drive somewhere.   - The towels at the pool are similar in size to dish towels. - Our room had roaches in it when we checked in.  It took them over 3 hours to move us to another room. - When we were out for the day there was NO maid service.  They left 4 towels on the back of the toilet but never took old towels or made the bed. - There was a water leak in the room and the entire wall was soaked and the celing was peeling and falling onto our things.  -More bugs in room 2 - not roaches - but other bugs covering the windows. - They have…

title: A piece of paradise on earth!
review: Well alright!  Perhaps the title is a bit of an exaggeration, but as far as my personal experience during  the time I stayed here at the Mike Ditka Resorts - Runaway Beach Club; I have to say it was more than I expected. We were a family of five, with two teenagers and one child age 5.  We had the 2 bedroom 2 bath suite and it was comfortable for everyone.  I doubt that we would have felt the same way, if we would have stayed at a regular boring hotel.  It felt like being at home, at least to us. We relaxed while enjoying the scenery and at the same time dipped into the south beach pool.  My Daughter enjoyed the key west  pool specifically for kids and so did the teenagers.  :-) Very nice and tranquil with Island music playing around the pool area.  Not crowded at all and the…

title: So many better places in the area
review: No way this place should be ranked 3.5 stars.  The place is just filthy and the customer service personel at the front desk were simply rude.  No where to eat within1/2 mile.   Cops were in building when my wife and I went to check in investigating a missing wallet from one of the rooms.  Enough said.

title: Plenty of space at the right price
review: My family of 4 recently had a nice long weekend in the Disney area.  This time we selected the Mike Ditka Runaway Beach.  We choose the destination for 2 primary reasons: 1. It offered plenty of space for us to spread out (we got a 1 bedroom that had 2 pull out sofas in the living area); and, 2. the summer rate was reduced to under $100 a night, which put us right in our "sweet spot" when getting lodging in Orlando.  The complex is a series of two story "houses" that have units configured into a variety of sizes.  Each unit has at least one full bathroom, full laundry room and fully equipped kitchen.  The clubhouse and pool were a short walk away from any of the buildings.  You can park right at your building, so that is a plus for us.  There was a huge walmat within walking…

title: Not worth it, skip it.....
review: We stayed here only 1 night (fortunately) and were very disappointed. We use trip advisor quite often and the rankings are usually pretty spot on, but not this time. How in the world is this resort ranking so high? There is not much to do with kids at this place and restaurants are a good drive away.  They have 2 pools that were overcrowded and small. The room was "freezing" and did not have a control to easily change it. The room also showed lost of wear and tear and was not very clean as we found dried food throughout the condo. 2 beds? What a joke. The pullout sofa in the family room was the most uncomfortable bed imaginable with a bar running right through the middle and the thinnest mattress available on the planet. If you have kids do not subject them to this torture.…

title: Can't Wait To Go Back!
review: We just returned yesterday after a 6 night stay at the Runaway.  I found it by surfing the web on Expedia, although I contacted the resort directly to book.  The location of the resort is perfect...close to Disney, shopping, restaurants, golf.  We arrived early and our room was ready.  I requested a 2nd floor condo and they had me in a 1st floor unit, but happily changed it to the 2nd floor to accommodate my request.  The unit was very clean and roomy.  My only complaints would be the air conditioning and the blinds.  The living room and kitchen area were never really cold enough for me, and the bedroom, bathroom and hallway were freezing (which didn't bother me, but my husband doesn't like being too cold).  I called the front desk and they came twice to adjust it, but I think…

title: Not what I expected/ you dont get what you pay for!
review: We arrived at the scheduled check-in time which was 3:00 pm on Thursday June 26, 2008. We were told that the room that we were orginally assigned wasnt ready and we would be put into another room. We went to our room which appeared to be clean but to my shock and dismay it wasnt. The bathroom had a toilet seat that should have been changed years ago, it has cracks on the entire seat so if you dare sit on it I would be concerned with being infected with something. The room was hot and we attempted to adjusted the cooling setting but to no avail, we had to call the front desk and they sent a maintenance man to unlock  the thermostate and his comment to us was "you want it lower than 75 degree". He proceeded to unlock it and left. I went to the restroom and found that the glasses…

title: Awesome stay
review: I personally loved it when we stayed  at Mike Ditka Resorts Runaway Beach Club. I own a timeshare down in the Cape. We  happened to stay at the Runaway Beach Club because of a bad experience at a resort that  I booked with our timeshare. We left in the middle of our vacation and stayed at the Runaway Beach Club I loved it. The unit was clean, very close to attractions, updated units, the only thing that i wished they had was a pool side bar or a resturant on site.Other then that everything was great .

title: Absolutely Wonderful!
review: I recently went down to Disney to enjoy a weekend with three of my friends.  After looking at several hotels on travel websites, we decided on Mike Ditka's Runaway Beach Club because we got a great deal (two bedroom loft for $149 a night!) and it seemed to be pretty close to the attractions, shopping and nightlife areas that we were interested in.   Let me say we absolutely made the right decision!  This place was fantastic!  It was literally minutes from Disney World and there was a Super WalMart right around the corner to get groceries and everything else we'd forgotten.  We didn't have any problems with the staff, in fact they were extremely helpful in all the encounters we had with them.  Every night when we came back we saw the security driving around the grounds and we had…

title: Loved it!!
review: Eight of us recently stayed 7 nights in a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo at this resort. It was truly amazing! It was very clean & very nicely decorated! The beds were super comfortable! Our master bath had a king size bed with a pillow top mattress on it. We had a garden tub/shower in our bathroom & a huge walk in closet with a safe! The bath towels were big & fluffy! The resort was centrally located near all the parks & attractions, right off Osceola Parkway! We were only 10 minutes to Disney Parks, 15 minutes to Gatorland, etc. It was close to several restaurants (Joe's Crab Shack, Chili's, Denny's, etc.) There is a Super Wal Mart literally just around the corner from the resort, which we visited several times. The fully furnished kitchen was handy & saved us some money from eating…

title: Great location, nice amenities, pretty good for the price
review: I booked a 3-bedroom villa through a special deal on an airline's website, and paid $129/night + the mandatory $10/night "resort fee". The property is nice, very pretty building looks and nicely maintained grounds. We were "upgraded" to a 3-bedroom loft at check-in.  The faucet and towel rack in the main bathroom were broken and there weren't enough towels. No kitchen linens or dish soap at all. These problems were fixed pretty quickly.  The beds were hard and somewhat lumpy (but I'm used to a Tempur-pedic mattress, so I know I'm picky). One morning, we were all awakened by the grounds maintenance crew mowing at 7:30 am. Otherwise, we could only hear people in the attached villas at the bottom of the stairs, not in our villa. My son's bedroom was completely dark at night, but we…

title: Loved It!!!
review: We booked this hotel through southwest airlines and paid $79 a night.  It made me very nervous because to me that was cheap.  I had my husband our two kids and grandma and it was great.  The grounds were beautiful and the staff was great.  Very friendly through the whole stay.  I did call ahead and request to be by the lagoon and pool area because of all the comments about the thin walls.  There were nights when we heard plenty of banging around from upstairs so be careful of the noise factor.  Otherwise it was great and the kids loved it.  Nice big rooms with a great kitchen area and the pool area is great.

title: Spacious villa, good location, great stay!
review: We stayed in a 3bedroom/2bath St. John villa the weekend of May 16, 2008.  We had 6 girls ages 12 & 16 to celebrate our daughters' birthdays.  This was the perfect place to stay for our large group without spending a fortune. Very roomy!  With that many girls running around, doing each other's hair, swapping clothes, thank goodness for the space!  I never felt frazzled because I was comfortable, and so were they.  The 2 long couches in the living room are a great idea.  The vanity areas (double sinks) in both baths are convenient.  The kitchen is very well stocked, plenty of plates and glasses.  I followed someone's advice and brought dishwasher detergent, dish soap & sponge & laundry detergent.  They do not provide even a sample of these items, which would be very disconcerting…

title: Excellent stay at the Runaway Beach Club!!
review: My husband and I took my sister to Disney World and I did a lot of research on places to stay offsite.  Mike Ditka's RBC resort was perfect.  The room was spacious and the setting was very relaxing.  We booked a combo flight/hotel via Expedia to get the a good deal on a 1 bedroom.  The staff was professional and prompt when we asked for an additional blanket.  A huge benefit to this resort is the location.  As mentioned in previous posts, RBC is located next to a Super Walmart.  Aditionally, it only took us 10-15 minutes to drive to Walt Disney World (we left around 8:30am and took Hwy 192 to avoid toll highways).  All in all, an excellent bargain for the price paid.

title: We loved it! Don't listen to negative reviews!!
review: This is a GREAT place to stay. It is so much larger and nicer than a hotel room. Our room was recently redone. It had a beautiful kitchen, granite countertops, full-size appliances including a refrigerator, dishwasher, etc. and cute beach paintings and other accessories that made it feel "homey". The master bedroom had it's own bathroom with a great shower/tub and a HUGE walk-in closet and a TV. The other bedroom had a HUGE walk in closet too, and a TV also. There was another TV in the main room. We stayed in a 2-br/2br condo. Another especially important thing, the hot water tank didn't run out!!!! We took consecutive, hot showers and it was always warm. There is a pretty lake and it's just a short, scenic walk to the pools. One pool has a kid play area that my kids loved.…

title: Home away from Home
review: My husband and I were traveling with my parents, going to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic via. Orlando.  We spent one night in Orlando.  I had originally booked us 2 rooms at a budget hotel when I got a "Hotwire Ticker" on the Runaway Beach Club.  The Beach Club was running a special and the price for a Suite was basically the same price as the 2 budget hotel rooms.  So I went ahead and booked the Beach Club.  To call our room a Suite was an understatement.  It was like coming to someones house!  We even had a garage (though we didn't use it).  Walk up some stairs to the main level and there was a full kitchen:  tons of flatware, dishes, cookware, refrigerator with an icemaker!  We had a loft with a airhockey / foosball table and a flat screen tv... another flat screen in the…

title: Wonderful!!!
review: This Resort was the best! We've stayed at other Resorts in the Orlando area  in past years but this one has our vote. It was CLEAN,QUIET,SPACIOUS, We just loved it  And we recommend it to everyone Thanks for the wonderful week!!!! The only thing we would like to see added are grills so we can cook out some evenings!

title: Perfect Stay, Great rates, Why stay in a room when you can have a home.
review: A Great stay...... We booked our 2 night stay for a fast weekend getaway to Disney. Let me start off by saying we are not " tourist" My family and I live in S. Florida and have been annual Pass holders to Disney as well as Universal for years.  We have stayed from anywhere from a night to a week in the Orlando area and I can not believe we have never come across Mile Ditka Resort before now, I really do not understand the negative reviews the resort as received. We booked the 2 bedroom w/loft and I must say was very impressed! Very large,clean,up to date decor. For what we paid for this ( I booked Expedia) you could not have stayed at a motel six in the Orlando area) I am a very picky person and love to be pampered but if you want a great family place with room to spare this is…

title: Watch your belongings!
review: We booked 2 suites May 11-18th 2008.  It would have been an  excellent stay, but we have two complaints.  1. Maid service stole my jacket and my youngest daughters'.  The resort has not offered to replace them. I left our jackets on the chair in the master bedroom.  I did not use them since it was 90 degrees all week, so I'd bet my life that I never took them out of the room like the hotel suggested I must have done.  The hotel apologized but I'm out  at least $200 for replacing the jackets. (Even though I spent over a grand with them).  The 2nd complaint is that we could hear the  upstairs neighbor children running back & forth and crying all night when trying to sleep.  Noisy!  The downstairs neighbors partied outside and I could hear their entire conversations through my…

title: A very mediocre experience...
review: Our stay started with the air conditioning not working very well, and first night we turned down sheets and there was blood on them.  Once getting clean sheets, and the airconditioning fixed the rooms themselves though getting a little beat up could be really nice for a large party.  The maid service is far from stellar, but I guess you get what you paid for.  The pools are  nice, and the location is great if visiting Disney parks or need to grab a quick bite to eat.  If this hotel just had a quick renovation it would be a great deal...but until that happens I expect the reviews to continue to get more and more negative.

title: Janice's Wedding
review: I expected better considering the price.  Even though you are charged a daily "amenties" fee in addition to the room charge, you are still expected to pay for internet usage.  I have never been at a facility that charged for coffee pod replacements for the coffee pot in the kitchen.  The gym was minimum and in disrepair.  They ran out of basic bathroom items (shampoo, conditioner, etc.).  And depending on which front desk person assisted you, you could not be sure of the accuracy of the directions given.  All in all, I expected more based on the amount of money that I paid.  I will not stay there again.

title: Nice place but there is better our there
review: This is a nice place to stay.  Not the greatest, but a nice place for a getaway.  It is like a villa of homes, and the one I stayed in was a 3 bedroom with 2 baths, kitchen, den and laundry room.  The master bed squeeked all night long and finally we had to put pillows behind the headboard to make it stop squeeking.  The blinds in the windows were thin and you woke up as soon as the sun came out.  It was clean but could have been spruced up with some paint.  The furniture was starting to show some ware.  All the bedrooms had a tv and the den has a tv.  This place has 2 pools, a hot tub, a nice deck.  There is a computer in the lobby but it cost $2.95 for 15 minutes of use.  There is a gym and a indoor basketball court.   Before you come to Orlando you may want to think about…

title: Quiet, Comfortable & Well Placed
review: We spent a very pleasent two weeks in Runaway Beach, after booking through Expedia on a flight/hotel package. The resort is fairly new and benefits from being relatively small compared to many similar resorts around the WDW/LBV area. It's extremely well situated, close to all the Disney parks and shopping areas, with a Super WalMart almost on it's doorstep.   I had phoned the resort before travelling and requested an apartment close to the pool and that's exactly what we were given. We had an upstairs "loft" apartment, one bed/bath, with a well supplied kitchen. The only slight drawback was the stairs up to the apartment - although they didn't trouble us, they could possibly be a problem for some. Service was good, with a maid coming in daily to make the beds, remove trash etc,…

title: Lovely experience
review: Stayed here several times for volleyball tournaments. Clean, accomodating and friendly staff. Just recently I had to cancel at the last moment due to a family medical emergency and they were so kind.... they refunded my deposit and wished me luck with my family situation.  I was so impressed and grateful. I wasn't even going to ask since it was so late but, they said not to worry and wished me well...nice to know there are businesses out there that take the human approach...thanks Runaway Beach..your the best....we will be back to visit soon!! A very grateful customer!

title: Fantastic Location for Disney
review: Booked through Expedia and got a great deal for 9 nights - including Flight and Car hire this was probably half the cost of a package holiday.  Very nicely surprised when we arrived and the condo's look lovely from outside, all pastels and clean.  My only disappointment was the locality of our unit, it was just yards from a very busy road, with only some bushes in between.  So at night and in the early morning the traffic noise was a little intrusive, however you can forgive that due to the savings we had made.  The apartment itself was brilliant - a proper kitchen with huge fridge, microwave, dishwasher, kettle, toaster and tea pot!!! The crockery was fully stocked and had everything we needed.  The bedroom was huge with a massive bed and a walk-in wardrobe that had oodles of…

title: We all loved this place
review: We stayed in the one bedroom with king bed which ended up having two pull out couches in the livingroom and the kids all enjoyed the novelty of sleeping together like that.  I did request a room on the lagoon side as other reviewers complained of the highway running along the backside of some of the outer ring buildings.  We could hear people walking upstairs at times, but I think they went to bed before us and got up after us, so that was not a problem.  The unit was so roomy, we did use the washer & dryer a few times, didn't see any bugs in our first floor unit & the trash was removed everyday.  Went to the nearby Walmart and bought groceries for breakfast, lunch & snacks.  It was an easy drive to the Disney parks.  The kids loved both pools.  No problems at check in or check…

title: Great Value at Runaway
review: We just got back from a week stay at Runaway in Orlando (Apr 26th to May 2nd).  We had an upper level 2 bedroom condo and were very happy with it.   We did a ton of research before booking this place and chose Runaway because of the mainly positive reviews and we really liked the photos that were posted.    We were not disappointed. We arrived at Runaway around noon and were allowed to check in early which was great.  Our unit was clean, bright and quiet.  The rooms were very large, the beds comfy.  My two kids shared a room which was perfect.   We even had a safe in the master bedroom closet so we left some valuables in there.  Some postings indicated that there was no daily housecleaning but our unit was cleaned daily to my surprise.    If you stay in a condo type accomodation…

title: BE CAREFUL AT THIS PLACE!!!
review: The condo was nice.  Unfortunately, the cleaning crew wasn't.  The Monday after Easter one of the cleaning crew stole my three diamond wedding ring from my make-up case that had been tucked away in a drawer of the bathroom vanity. When we returned from spreading my son-in-laws ashes, we found that the rooms had not been cleaned, the beds were unmade and the garbage still sitting in the kitchen.   We didn't discover this until we returned home. After numerous calls that were not returned, we had to resort to pretending we wanted to book a stay.  This is the only way we could get someone to call us back. That was a waste of time as they denied everything, thus becoming a part of the theft ring. IF you stay there, don't take anything of value.  If your fingers swell like mine did, …

title: Perfect Location for all the theme parks
review: We are a family with 3 children and booked this accomodation as it stated that it was close to Disney on the website. We were not disppointed. The hotel is made up of lots of detached 2 storey apartments. We were allocated a ground floor 2 bedroom condo which had a view of the lake from the front windows, which was pleasant. There was a huge bed in the master bedroom, and a large double and a single bed in the second bedroom. We also had a laundry cupboard washing machine & tumble dryer, which I found very useful for keeping up with the washing. The cleaner came every day and made the beds, cleaned bathrooms and emptied bins, which was a great help.   Staff were very helpful and the maintenance man came within the hour when we had a problem.  The 2 pools were very nice and the…

title: very nice for one night
review: I got a special through hotwire, to stay at a great rate, so I booked my family of 5 for one night between Disney and Tampa. My kids loved the room.  We had the one bedroom with loft, and we had an upper-be warned the stairs are a killer-it you have any mobility problems ask for a lower.  The room was clean except for the ceiling fans and the vents-uuugh-all it takes is a swipe from the vacuum.  We loved the washer and dryer and the kitchen,after 5 days with Disney Dining we were ready for some home cooking.  This hotel was 1/3 the price of our two rooms at the Caribbean Beach, and the rooms are spacious.  The only issue I had was that the bathroom was off the master bedroom and the walls are so thin, it was okay for one night but with 3 girls we would get the 2 bedroom 2 bath…

title: Housekeeping unaccountable
review: Housekeeping is not accountable to the front desk at all, and appears to do whatever they want to do. Warning to would be travellers to this hotel - don't leave valuables in your room at this place.  Unfortunately, my wife and son left their only jackets for the trip in the bedroom closet after check-out. We remembered they were there and went back only 2 hours later to pick them up and the jackets were missing and the room was made up!!   The next three days, my wife and I left 3 messages with housekeeping to return calls, and to front-desk to check with housekeeping again and then to return calls. Calls never returned at all by anyone!

title: A great place for a great price
review: My family was there all last week for 7 nights.  We were very pleased w/our accommodations. We had a 3 bedroom unit located across the lake & to the left of the pool/office area.  Fortunately our unit was on a top floor & inside one of the courtyards so any outside or neighbor noise was at a minimal. We were traveling w/two 17 yr old boys & one college age male & they enjoyed the basketball court & weight room in the evenings.  We liked the fact that it wasn't in a high rise w/elevators to deal with & very easy to park practically at your door.  If you have an outside floor unit you can park at your door. The location is convenient to all parks & activities.  Having a Super Walmart w/in walking distance was also handy.  The maid service is limited unless you want to pay extra…

title: Not what I excpected!
review: The staff was great, but my overall stay was less than expected. Upon arrival I had to have the floors cleaned. We were also in a room that had been stained by a leak somewhere on the roof. I had to clean the tables because their was still food left from the guest before us. We love to travel and expect our rooms to be clean upon arrival. We were very dissappointed. If you can, stay somewhere else.

title: not bad
review: It wasn't bad.  I do agree with previous postings about the walls being paper thin.  I could hear everything going on on the unit above us.  They had no 2nd floor units available, otherwise I'd ask for that one.  I didn't get traffic noise because I was on the lake side, so that was good.  It was clean, but if they choose white comforters they need to make sure they are stain free.  They had a couple of stains!  I was happy though on the cleanliness.  I can't complain about the bathrooms, actually they were spic and span.  We went with 3 teenagers and it was perfect for them.  The 2 bedroom suite had enough space for them and us.  OVerall I do recommend it.

title: Condo?  Hotel?  Best of both worlds!
review: Runaway Beach Club was almost perfect for our trip to the Orlando/Space Coast area.  We were invited to watch the Space Shuttle launch in early March, and needed to find a place where we had room for our family of seven, and that could also handle the uncertainty of the launch dates.  Most places that are large enough to accomodate our family (like condos or rental houses) will not let you change dates without a huge penalty, but the Runaway Beach Club would let us reschedule without penalty (check their policy to make sure it's what you need).  There was also no penalty to cancel up to 72 hours before check in.  Their cancellation policy is more like a hotel than a condo.  Their units are more like condos, however, which is exactly what we wanted.  We had a two-bedroom unit,…

title: Large and comfortable
review: We were in between resorts and scheduled a one-night stay at MDR Runaway Beach Club.  We booked a two-bedroom with two beds in one of them for the kids.  The suite we were placed in was on the lake side, back side of the building.  There seems to be at least 3 suites and probably 4 per unit (we were only there one night and I didn't notice).        We arrived early and were hoping to get checked in early, but that did not happen.  You can't really expect this so I don't hold it against them,  The person at the counter offered to let us change and use the facilities which was nice of him.  The kids were able to use the pool and the basketball court while we waited for our suite.        We couldn't check in until slightly after 4 PM.  Upon checking into our place we found it to be…

title: Disappointing
review: Wow-stayed with the wife and 2 kids here last week and cannot believe how my experience was so different than 90% of these reviews--I travel frequently and know things are never perfect. But-there are 8 units on the backside of the resort next to a major highway and the traffic noise was ridiculous-avoid these units. The unit itself was not clean--food/coffee stains in kitchen--hair on bathroom floor with mold in tub caulking/curtain--hair and stain on room comforters and the worst problem was the paper thin celing--if you are a light sleeper, better have an upstairs room or you'll be up all night like us if you have loud guests nearby. I believe your experience will totally depend on where you are located in the complex and if you are near the lake maybe it will be more…

title: An awful lot of bang for your buck!
review: I was leary of it being all a bit too good to be true, but it was the perfect location for our family.  Hotel staff was OK, not super, but the room was clean (few cobwebs and dusty overhead fans but such high ceilings I can forgive it!) and very spacious.    We were traveling with our kids 18 and 9 so having space to chill out separately was very nice.  I did a load of laundry almost daily, and went home with no piles to contend with.  Very close to Disney and every restaurant and convenience could not be closer.    Pool was nice, I could do without the music all the time as it's peaceful to read and just sit and soak up the sun--but today everyone wants noise all the time.  The kitchen was very manageable and it was nice to have breakfast in.  We had fresh baked cookies out of…

title: Spacious and new, but beware of traffic noise in outer units!
review: We were taking a family trip to Disney. Our two kids are 11 and 7. They LOVED the 3bdr Loft unit. My son slept in the loft and my daughter had a bedroom to herself. So that was great, we were not on top of each other. Everything was brand new and clean. It is furnished in a pretty beach motif, with white louvered furniture.  The kitchen was new with granite countertops.   The only problem and it was big, was our first unit backed up to the main road right behind the hotel. THE NOISE WAS AWFUL! We could not sleep at all. So the next day we got moved to an interior unit that lined the lagoon. GORGEOUS! It was so peaceful and pretty. We could not hear the road noise at all. So definitely stay away from the buildings in the outer ring and go for an inner unit. (I want to say it was…

title: Hidden Gem
review: The best surpise in years!  My husband and I enjoyed our master suite and our teenage daugters loved their own room and bathroom.  Exceptionally clean, fully stocked kitchen, comfy beds, plenty of towels and the light housekeeping service that comes with your booking is perfect. The resorts is close to all the area attractions and yet you feel like you're tucked away in a nice quite oaisis.  The staff was very accomodating and my only  advice is that if you have young kids or don't like stairs......request a ground floor villa and if you can get a lagoon unit even better!   We will definately stay here on our next trip.

title: Beware of the PAPER THIN walls!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: My wife and I and our 12 year old daughter stayed for 3 nights in March 2008 and had two great nights and one bad night because of noisy neighbors. The condo location and facitlites are top rate.  Condos are spacious and have laundry facilities in each unit, basketball gym, workout room, pool, spa,..everything you can think of EXCEPT insulated walls!  If you are unfortunate enough like we were and happen to be on the first floor with noisy neighbors above you, you will hear EVERYTHING -- not only their footsteps, but their voices (clearly) their phone, their TV.  The condos have paper thin walls and are poorly insulated.  Furthermore the staircase to the second floor condos runs through the first floor units -- it's the closet in between the master bedroom and the living room. …

title: Clean, convenient, and valuable!
review: What a wonderful way to vacation! This resort is 5 mins to the Disney entrance...very convenient and proximal to everything a visitor could want -theme parks, shopping, and restaurants.  The property itself is beautiful! It seems more like a residence than it does a hotel. We stayed in a 2 bedroom villa for about $140 a night. Each room had it's own bathroom and walk in closest. Couple this with a large living room, granite kitchen, and washer/dryer, and you have a vacation filled with relaxation. Tons of room and tons of convenience! It was so nice to go to the Walmart (50 feet away) and buy food so we could stay in and relax versus having to go out to eat for every meal! This was a first for our family and we loved it!  If you are not afraid of driving, and think you would…

title: Absolutely Amazing Resort!
review: From check in to check out, everything was absoutely above the bar. The front desk workers were friendly and helpful - they actually displayed customer service!  The lobby and ground are very well kept and clean. The area was quiet and it's close to social spots (restaurants and Walmart) and fairly close to the Interstate. The extra cost (compared to a hotel) is definitely worth it!!! This was my second stay and I would recommend it to anyone. It truly feels more like home away from home than a hotel/resort.

title: Everything Was Wonderful!
review: Our family enjoyed this top-notch resort! Our condo was beautifully decorated, nice bright colors. Loved the 3 TV's - one in each bedroom and the living room! Our kids (6 & 8) loved the pools! Staff was very accommodating  to our needs. Close to major Florida attractions. Will definitely recommend to friends and family! Wish we would have booked a longer stay!

title: Better than a Ritz
review: We found this little resort village to be even more spacious and comfortable than our favorite, Ritz Carlton hotels. It was a complete apartment, rather than just a room, where we would have been happy to live full time. The beds and pillows were so soft and comfortable we didn't want to get out of bed all day. The resort grounds are a beautiful, modern little village that is built around a small lake where almost everyone has a view. A great heated pool and hot tub as well as kiddie wet area are also offered, as well as a killer fitness center. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpfull and we just can't say enough good things about them and the resort. We also found the resort to be conveniently located within the general tourist area of Central Florida, near many…

title: great hotel
review: We booked this hotel for a night for my daughters 15 birthday. The hotel was clean and close to oldtown. We booked a 1 bedroom loft , we had 2 adults and 4 teenagers and there was plenty of room for them to have fun and us to relax in our own bedroom. The loft had a pull out and a foosball table and the living room had 2 pull out couches.  Icant say enough good things about this resort. Its a first rate hotel that gives you the extra room and only charges 10.00 resort fee. Alot of "condo" hotels charge a cleaning fee of 60 dollars if you stay less than 5 nights so.... this is a great deal for short stays. There is an indoor basketball court and adult pool, fitness room and kids pool. The only thing missing is a volleyball court, but if your going to the parks this isnt…

title: Perfect for families with young kids!!!
review: We stayed here for 2 nights and we wished we had booked it for longer!! This is an outstanding place for families with young kids. The kitchen is well-equipped for making breakfasts and packing lunches (recommended for theme park goers) and the washer and dryer in our unit really came in handy! We brought our kids bikes and scooters and they happily rode for an hour in the adjacent courtyard to our room! The pools were fantastic, but the exercise room to not live up to expectation.

title: Amazing
review: What a wonderful place! I am one of those people that will not travel b/c I am so afraid of the hotels and if I have too, I bring my own sheets and sanitize the bed and mattress.So, when l had to find a place for our first real vacation with the kids I had to have something that was as close to the comforts of home that I could get. I FOUND IT!! The villas went beyond my expectations and supassed my level of home comfort. They are not your standard hotel  were everybody is holed in one room. These villas have sepreate bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, eating area, living room, washer and dryer.And not your cheap stuff, state of the art.  It was clean, safe, and the pool & recreation areas were great !! The service was also great. We miss the stay here more than any part of our trip!…

title: Best hotel Ever!
review: I stayed hat Mike Ditks's Runaway Beach club during the spring Break. I had a party of 7 and we stayed in a 2bedroom suite. It was beautiful. The room was spacious with the comforts of home.  There was a king size  bed in the master room. A full size bed and a single in the second room. In the Livingroom there was two pull-out sofas. Just when I thought that it couldn't be better , there was a washer and drier,dishwasher,stove,oven.microwave,utensils,pots,pans,cups etc. . I could go on and on. The customer service was great. Always greeted with a smile. The location was terrific. Less than three miles from Walt Disney World. There wasn't room service so you could go buy your own groceries .  Your not to far from the resturants and shopping  area. The pool was very relaxing. If…

title: Nice but minor improvements needed
review: I received one of many email offers for travel specials that I get on a daily basis. I had decided to go to Florida for a quick, short getaway and wanted to spend some time in Disney. An email from Runaway Beach offered a one bedroom condo-type unit for $79 per night! Pretty good, I thought. So I booked 4 nights and received a confirmation with a total of $434.28 with tax. I had booked Jet Blue from Boston for the same price; $79 one way. I figured this would be an inexpensive Florida getaway.  To top it off, I rented a car for the 4 days for $67. When I arrived at the Resort, I was pleased by the clean surrondings and gated entry. The staff checked me in but I noticed they had a total of over $800 for my stay! I called from my room and was told it was their error and they…

title: Good Choice for Visiting Walt Disney World
review: I stayed at Runaway Beach Club (RBC) in mid-January of 2008 with my extended family. We booked a 2-bedroom, 2-bath unit in the Key West section. As expected, there were two full baths and two large bedrooms. We could have upgraded (free) to a 2-bdr, 2-bath loft suite (which would have had another loft room with a pull-out sofa bed and an air-hockey table), but one of our guests had mobility issues and couldn't climb the necessary stairs. The master had a king size bed, flat-screen TV, huge walk-in closet with electronic safe, and master bath with Jacuzzi tub and separate shower. The second bedroom had a double (full) bed and a twin (single) bed, suitable for three children but really only two adults (I personally find a double bed too small for two adults). This bedroom also had…

title: Home Away From Home !!!
review: My family stayed 12/01 to 12/09.  Two adults and two children.   We had a quick and easy check in, no hassels.  2 bed/2bath condo, king size bed in the master suite with a soaking tub, shower and very large walk in closet.  There was a in room safe that we were unable to use because my son ( 6 years old going on 35)  insisted on knowing the  combo and then putting a totally different one causing the safe not to lock.  What fun.  Maintenace unable to reset so I just kept my personal belongings with me.  The second bedroom had a twin and full size bed and extremely large walk in closet.  The second bath was large with a shower/tub and one sink.  On that Thursday there were ants.  Was told bugs are common in FL and we'll spray for you.  Killed them but I had to clean up myself.…

title: Wonderful Place For Large Family
review: My family of 2 adults and 4 children stayed here the first week of January.  We stayed in a St. Johns unit.  It had 3 bedrooms.  It was perfect for our family.  There was plenty of space for each person to relax and be comfortable.  There were tvs in every bedroom and one in the front room.      Our unit showed minor wear and tear.  There were scratches on the coffee table in the living room.  A headboard on one of the beds came unattached when my son sat on the bed.  Some of the bedding had stains on the comforters.    The roominess of the unit and the excellent price we got by booking 6 months in advance on the hotel website made those problems  not even bother us.  The front desk staff were great.  They were very friendly and helpful.  We needed directions to one of the theme…

title: Heaven for my nine year old daughter and myself!!
review: WOW!!!! The Mike Ditka Runaway Beach Club was like a dream come true from top to bottom. The front desk welcomed us from the start and continued to do anything possible for us throughout our stay!! The property was spotless and absolutely beautiful. My daughter Kalynn and I could not have chosen a better place to stay. Our Villa was outstanding in all aspects. We jumped on the shuttle bus every morning and were escorted only a few miles away to our Disney Destinations. We felt safe and right at home atmosphere throughout our trip and time we spent at the Runaway Resort.. As a parent their is nothing I can think of that This Resort could possible offer :-)  Thank You all !!!!

title: Nice Value....Poorly Run and Managed!
review: My fiance and I stayed at the resort December 14 through 16 and were very unhappy with our room and location.  Upon our arrival December 14 we checked in at approximately 10:30am and got sent to our room 13205.  Upon arriving at our building I noticed the cleaning departments bins and equipment up and down the  walkway area and spillng our of the garages.  At that time we didn't think anything of it!  On December 15th we were woken up at about 630am from the loud noises and talking from the cleaning crew.  During that time I had fallen asleep  only to be woke  up by their continous loud noise they were making.  When we left our room at approximately 12:00 noon there were still numerous bins garbage bags and a golf cart in our entranceway in fact it was sitting right outside our …

title: Great Disney Vacation Condo
review: We stayed at the Runaway Beach Club on Dec. 17-21, 2007 and, despite the good reviews, we were still pleasantly surprised with the condo. Check-in was a breeze with courteous front desk attendants. They told us that there were no 2 bedroom condos available, so they were upgrading us to a 2 bedroom with a loft. The condo was huge (it would sleep 11!) and immaculate with all the comforts of home. For $99 a night, it was THE bargain in the Orlando area. Because we had a full kitchen, we saved a bundle on food by eating breakfast at "home" each day and packing lunches to take to the parks.  We had free light housekeeping each day while we were gone. They took out the trash, gave us fresh towels, and changed the sheets one day as per our request. We did not have a single problem from…

title: Recommended for any Orlando, FL visitor
review: I'd like to start my review by saying that I travel on business and with family quite a bit.  I have never been impressed with a property enough to take the time to visit a website and post my experience...until now!!!  This place is awesome.  I read a lot of the reviews before booking and decided that for the money this was the place to stay.  I was so impressed with the property.  My wife, my 6 year old, my mom, and I stayed in the Martique which is a two bedroom, two full-bath with a loft apartment and it was amazing.  It would have slept 7 people comfortable and 11 if you wanted to stretch it.  The location is great too. 15 minutes from the airport. 10 minutes from Disney. Walking distance to Wal*Mart. Located on a shopping and eatery oriented area. They also provide AAA…

title: Nice enough for our stay.
review: We read many reviews before booking, majority were positive so we decided to book.  we stayed three nights in december.  Six people in our group 3 children and 3 adults, we stayed in a two bedroom suite.  Very spacious rooms, clean.   we did go to the pools one afternoon during a break from the parks they were nice for a break.  No problems during our stay only three nights.  We didnt spend much time in the rooms.  Would recomend to friends to stay here.

title: Not so clean
review: Choose this hotel based on the reviews.  It was disappointing to find a tub with huge patched crack, dirty comforter, hairs on the night stand, toilet was not clean, bed was uncomfortable, linens were stained and dingy.  Housekeeping was not good.   Did like the kitchen and convenience.  The overall facility was well maintained.  Have stayed at 2 star hotels that were nicer than this one - especially for the money.

title: Would highly recommend
review: We had the one-bedroom, one-bath unit, 2-204.  It had a living room with two pull-out couches, king bed in bedroom.  Well-appointed kitchen.  They provided a basket with Starbucks coffee packets, sugar, salt, powdered creamer.  We had to provide laundry soap and dish soap.  We were provided clean towels every day.  Pool towels are provided in pool area.  There's a Wal-Mart right across the street.  And the on-ramp to the Oceola Parkway (a short drive to all Disney Parks) is just across from the property.  The staff even organized kid activities in the pool area.  There's a business center where we could print boarding passes the night before departure.  We were extremely pleased with Runaway Beach Resort.  I would highly recommend it!

title: Good, Bad, Dos, and Donts
review: My wife, parents, two daughters and I stayed at this resort recently on a trip to Walt Disney world.  While we did get the room heavily discounted by touring another timeshare on this property, this review only reflects our stay at Runaway Beach Club.  However please see the “dos and donts” section of this review if you plan to go the timeshare discount route.  This “resort” is nice and fits the 3 star rating accordingly.   Guests can enjoy resort amenities like the outdoor heated pool, hot tub, fitness center, and a business center in the reception area.   We stayed in a two bedroom suite with 1 king bed, second bedroom with one full bed and one twin bed, separate living room, and kitchen, ceiling fans, full-sized washer & dryer, in-room safe, and covered-private entrance.  It…

title: Loved the Runaway Beach Club
review: This place is wonderful.  We had a two bedroom and two bath suite for a very good price.  It was much cheaper than the Disney property we stayed at the first part of our trip.  The buildings are all new.  The furniture was new.  The condo was decorated in a very cheery manner.   There was so much space and even a washing machine and dryer.  The grounds were immaculate with two pools, a hot tub, and a gorgeous lake.  The staff was very nice.  This is probably the best deal anywhere near Disney.  They do have a shuttle they share with the Country Inn and Suites across the road.  But it only has three outgoings and three incomings all day and only goes to Epcot.  But it was nice to know it was an option.     The only complaint we had was with drains not draining as fast as they…

title: Pretty Convenient
review: We stayed here for 2 nights after a cruise and found it to be adequate. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and the grounds were clean and well maintained. The unit we had was the bottom line one and I can imagine that there are better units available, but we booked through Hotwire at a low rate so of course you won't get the show unit. That's OK though. My kids were sleeping on a pull out that had zero padding and was basically springs under cloth, I brought to the attention of the front desk staff and within 1 hour they had installed a new mattress for the kids. Pretty impressive! We wished we had time to use the pool because it looked pretty nice and was quite warm unfortunately we were cramming in a lot of sight seeing and shopping in those 2 days. Oh well next time. …

title: An OK holiday!
review: We spent 12 days at the Runaway Beach Club, and we went based on the reviews that we saw on here.  Arriving in the early evening, we checked in smoothly, and arrived at the condo.  There were three of us travelling, and we had requested a cot (crib) for our 18 month old daughter, we asked for this in advance, so we expected it to be there. It wasn't, we had to ring up an external company and order it, this arrived the next day, and resulted in us moving furniture around so we could put a mattress on the floor for her to sleep on. Not ideal on the first night. Throughout the holiday, the service was peppered with let downs and minor hassles.  We asked 3 or 4 times for a change of towels and bedding, and were told that they would be sent 'right over', they never turned up, so we…

title: Absolutely Wonderful!
review: We stayed at Runaway Beach Club Resort from 10/31 to 11/5/07.  What a wonderful place!  Can't say enough good things about it.  The staff was absolutely fabulous--every single one of them.  From the front desk to housekeeping to maintenance and the General Manager too--incredibly friendly and helpful.  We stayed in a 1 bedroom unit with a king bed.  Everything was very clean and well-kept.  We received clean towels daily with no hassels.  Pool towels were plentiful, as well.  Speaking of the pools, there are two--one for adults and one for the kids.  Didn't use the kids' pool but the adult pool was very clean and heated just enough to take the chill off--perfect!  Great location.  Very close to just about anywhere you'd want to go in the Kissimmee/Orlando area.    This resort…

title: Nice...especially for large families
review: I would stay here again.  The condo fit our needs.  A family of 5 we were going to have to find 2 hotel rooms because we would be on top of each other if we didn't but this was perfect for us.  We had a 2 bedroom condo with 2 full bathrooms and it was plenty big. Very spacious.  We could have easily fit more.  The pool area was simple but fit our needs.  Your not going to find slides...but a nice area for smaller and larger kids...14, 7 and 3 year old all liked it.   Much nicer than any hotel room...much nicer than the disney sport, swan, or the average hotel room.  If I was buying a condo I would recommend their floor plan but I would be concerned of quality of work...but I wasn't buying one...just enjoying one.  Condo was clean.  Plenty of towels and toilet paper.  I would…

title: Hate, Hate, Hate
review: Stayed here in Oct with 2 kids, staff were awful 1 member ignored me until she had finished her conversation! Left do not disturb sign on door and came in anyway! Cot was broke and instead of replacing it, handyman (who took 2 hours to get to room) just wrapped tape around it!  Do not stay here!!!!!

title: Nice place; fair location & brightly lit
review: I stayed here for a business trip since I like to take care of my own meals when I travel and hate living out of standard hotel rooms.  The staff was very friendly on arrival (less so on departure - but its was 5am when I left).  My unit (an apartment with two bedrooms, a living room and kitchen/dining area) was clean and well appointed.  My stay was, overall, pleasant.  I didn't get to use any of the other facilities of the resort so I have no comment on them.  Some issues, however - first, the place is very brightly lit at night and the street lights shine in through the venetian blinds - it was impossible to completely block out the lights; second - they don't provide dish soap and only one pack of detergent for the dishwasher and no laundry soap (other resort accomodations…

title: Awesome!!!!!!!
review: I travel a lot for business. Mike's is a great place to stay for an extended period. I brought the family with, plus 2 friends of our kids. Plenty of room. The kids had their area and my wife and I had ours. Great price for the size of the room. It was a home away from home. It was nice to have a kitchen and washer & dryer. We were able to food and snacks at walmart and make small meals in our kitchen. Also, we could leave everything in the room without worry since there is only maid service if you request it. Why stay at the big name hotels and pay for services you won't use. The pool here was excellent and they even had "float in movies". I would have had to pay triple the rate at any other hotel to get the same type of room. Granted, this is probably more for a working class…

title: Not Impressed--would not stay here again!
review: My husband and I, our 4 year old little guy and friends of our who had a little girl stayed at this property on Thursday, Oct. 18th.  The place seemed ok.  Check in was great but the additional $5 per night for security seemed a little ridiculous.  The pool was very clean and quiet.  However, we had incredibly rude guests who stayed below us and they kept ringing our door bell at night saying we were too loud.  They complained to the front desk and even called us twice...only it wasn't us!  We had two small children and we were all in bed early because we were doing the whole Disney thing the next day.  When I tried to explain this to management, they weren't very cooperative.  They woked the kids up twice and it was hard to get them back to sleep.  In addition, the next morning…

title: Excellent - but be aware how service works
review: Many posters have mentioned the service.  This resort is not actually a hotel - if you carefully read your confirmation letter you will note that housekeeping services, coffee, etc. cost extra.  Your room is provided with a vacuum cleaner, washer/dryer, dishwasher etc. so you can do it yourself to save some money - or you can let the desk know you'd like services provided.  Our rooms were clean, bright, and very large; just what you would expect from a resort condo.  The kitchen was well-stocked with everything we needed to prepare meals, and there is a large Wal-Mart right around the corner for grocery shopping.  Parking was secure and simple.  If you are staying for an extended time in Orlando, I reccomend this place.  We were too busy to enjoy the pool, but we checked out the…

title: Fantastic !!!!
review: I read nearly all the reports before going and can only say some people are either unlucky or fussy. I know rooms can have issues but from my trip which was my wife and myself, as managed to leave kids this time at home. We booked a 2 bedroom property as cheaper on website than a 1 bed !! Reception - good, very friendly, efficient and helpful. Had asked for upstairs rooms as read reports of noisy feet from above, so ended up with place with loft as games room - never to old to play. First impression was WOW and this grew during our 10 night stay. Kitchen had all we needed but eat out every day. Living room great with TV and DVD Loft had TV. Washing machine and dryer which we used to wash clothes and towels, towels were changed not daily but just as easy to put in wash as going…

title: Wonderful Experience!!!
review: Our family of 4 stayed at the RBC in Aug. of 2007. The accomodations were fantastic! We stayed in a 1 bdrm. unit. It had a king sized master bedroom, walk-in closet, bathroom, and an open kitchen/dining room and living room. It also had a washer/dryer in a closet in the hallway, I first thought that was a waste b/c I don't want to do laundry on vacation, but we ended up using it quite a bit! It was more than enough room for the 4 of us. The kids loved the pool and basketball court. It was very clean and seemed pretty new, too.  I would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a great bargain!

title: Had a Great Time-Would stay there again.
review: Our stay at the Runaway Beach Resort was above average. We had 5 adults and 2 children. We had a 3 bedroom with a loft. Loft area had a sofa sleeper, TV and fooseball table. Wasn't to sure about my 77 yr. old father climbing the stairs everyday, but from what I've read on other reviews, the 2nd floor is where you want to be., to avoid running children.  Check in went rather smoothly. The first day/night was not great. Our A/C was not working, didn't have one of the channel changers, broken fooseball table and was missing a frying pan. Maintenance fixed the A/C when we were at dinner, brought another channel changer and fixed the fooseball table. No frying pan, though.  Had to scramble eggs in a sauce pan. The unit was large, spacious and clean. For a person with a bad back, the…

title: Not a great experience
review: Maybe we just had a bad experience.... The staff is very nice and the location is convient to theme parks. We arrived early, so we checked our bags (or had the staff store then in the office), and went out to one of the theme parks.  We returned in the evening.  The first room we were given was small, but relatively clean, decor a little worn, but nice- our concearn was that it was on the second floor and the stairs lead right up into the living room, and had no door this was an accident waiting to happen for our 18 month old son- we asked if they had a child gate or any rooms on the first floor.  They moved us to another room on the first floor, this one was much larger (it was located on the highway side, but we did not really mind that much about that), but as soon as we had…

title: beyond perfect
review: We went  Aug 21st for 2 nights and had a 2 bdr suite. We had views of the lake/pool area Downstairs. I go to Disney about 4 times a year (2 of us) this time i took my parents who had not been in DIsney in30 years. I needed a bigger place...also my sister and nephew cam along. So staying on DIsney property or a regular room was not in the budget.  THIS PLACE IS THE BEST. I would compare this to a Disney Vacation Home.   LOCATION: Perfect...5 min to downtown disney and another 5 to any of the parks. Not far at all. Also close to shopping area and places to grab a bite.  GROUNDS: Fantastic pool area. Lobby was inviting. And the service at check is was amazing.  SUITE: It was beyond perfect. Clean and so much space. WE had 7 closets and 4 were walk in. Washer and dryer, full kitchen…

title: Overall a Great Place to Stay
review: We just returned from 6 days in Orlando, at the Runaway Beach Club condos.  Our check in went very well, with very attentive staff, and a NO CHARGE upgrade to a 3 bedroom condo.  The grounds are very well kept, and the pool area is wonderful for the family. Our condo was very nice.  All 3 bedrooms had very comfortable beds, and there were 2 full baths as well.   I had only 2 complaints about the room itself.  First - they could have done a bit better when cleaning.  We did a bit of touch up in the kitchen after arriving, but the bathrooms were great.  The other issue did not really affect us - but the walls do seem to be very thin. We were there during the week, for the most part.  But, on the final night (sat) when there were more people, it was easy to hear the people below…

title: Great Place!!!! Would Def. Stay Here Again!!!
review: This place is great!  We loved it.  The units are individually owned and they are really spacious.  We are a family of four.  Two adults, 1 child, and 1 infant...(actually the infant has more "gear" than anyone else LOL!) but we had PLENTY of room in a one bedroom unit.  The closets are HUGE and the safe is really nice and we felt very secure leaving our valuables in it.    The kitchen was great and had plenty of utensils; although we spent most of our time at Disney and Sea World; so we didn't really use it to cook.  It was nice to have though; and if we we had stayed longer, it would've been great.  The pool area was very nice and the kid pool was a terrific spot for my daughter to play.  We even went to the park late one day so she could play in it.  The whole pool/deck area…

title: Very Nice Place
review: - easy check in - $5 / day resort fee not charged by website - the room I booked was unavailable so they upgrade me for free - clean room.  No regular house cleaning other than new towels and taking out the garbage eveyday. - kiddy pool and adult pool were clean and quiet - Location cannot be any better / Disney is 5 minutes away, Walmart across the street and restaurants near by - worth the price / I will always check this property first when I go back to Orlando

title: Wonderful!
review: We stayed just one night.  Wanted a reasonable hotel that would be comfortable for four women to have some space.  The condo is equipped with all amenities.  We were in the Antiqua unit and it had two sleeper couches.  We doubled up in the master bedroom and the other two had a couch each.  Great kitchen.  In the morning went over to the local Walmart and bought breakfast items and we had a lovely breakfast in the room.  Highly recommend this hotel.  15 mins. from Universal Studios.  Gated condos.

title: Excellent!!!
review: The best in Kissimmee! We stayed there two times during our vacation in August. Both times we got one bedroom suite with really spacious kitchen and large bathroom. We had a pretty view on the lagoon and pool.The place is very well maintained, there is a washer and dryer in the suite. The pools are very nice with abundance of  loungers.  There is free internet access in the lobby. Also we had a very good experience with the front desk. This place is very close to Disney.  I would recommend it!!

title: Great place for extended families
review: We were 13 people from 6 months to 60 and everyone had room to move around.  The washer came in handy we did a couple of loads a day.  The pool is open to 11PM which made it nice when you came  back from the parks.  It was nice to have a full kitchen so we did not have to eat every meal out.   Our refrigerator did not work when we got there and maintanence took care of the problem quickly.  The kids loved the  loft my son brought his WII and they had a place to themselves to play games while the rest of us had the living room and kitchen area to visit.  We would definatly stay there again.

title: Great Value home from home accomodation
review: We have just returned from a 2 week holiday in Florida. Our first week was at the Runaway Bay Resort, had I know that this place was going to be so great we never would have travelled down to Naples for a chill out after our hectic week in the theme parks.  The runaway bay is a home away from home, it is well equipt with every thing you need for a self catering holiday, we didn't even bother to eat out for breakfast and even cooked a few evening meals in (something i usually refuse to do).  The pool area we got round to using on our last day is perfect for chillin and there are more than plenty of shaded and sunny loungers to choose from. The children’s pool was perfect for my 8 year old. My 14 year old was disappointed to discover an indoor basketball court on the day we were…

title: Runaway Beach Club is great!!!
review: My husband, myself and another couple rented a 1 bedroom w/ a loft condo at the Runaway Beach Club.  Where I have heard that others had problems with the front desk, we experienced none.  I wouldn't call their service there "a knockout"...but it definitely wasn't bad.  I'll try to give an "all-inclusive" review. Check-in/out: Speedy, friendly, no problems.  They didn't include any extras, but it was pleasant.   Property: Large and in charge. :) The property is very clean, very quiet, and very nice.  Good landscaping.  We didn't use the pool or exercise room, but they both looked sufficient.   Rooms: Clean, spacious, GREAT kitchen.  The room was large, the loft was large.  Would easily sleep 8 people.  The pull-out couches were actually fairly comfortable!!  They do not replace…

title: beautiful hotel
review: gorgeous place..... we had more than enough room..... had 2 bedrooms & a loft, plus 2 sofa beds.... wanted to move in permanently!.... pool area was very nice..... walls are thin though,  constantly worried that the kids were too loud.... master bath was awesome... would love to return one day

title: Wonderful stay!
review: The resort is so colorful and it felt just like home!!  It was kept so clean, the kiddie pool was awesome, kids loved it.  Also had an adult pool.  Keep in mind that the kiddie pool closes at dusk so you'll need to move to the "adult" pool, which is only 5 ft deep, so it's not bad!  Lots of seating at the pool, and Friday night they have movies at the pool for the kiddies!  The one bedroom we had was great, had all the comforts of home.  We washed our laundry and put the trash out front for pickup, so it wasn't necessary for maid service.  I really didn't mind.  It's close to everything!  Disney was like 10 minutes away, gatorland 10 minutes, downtown disney 10 minutes, seaworld maybe 20 minutes.  I was told there would be laundry detergent, dish soap, etc. but there wasn't any…

title: Very nice place, spacious and convenient
review: We really liked it here.  We had a 2BDRM 2 BATH villa that was extremely clean, very spacious, well equipped, and attractively decorated.  The beds were very comfortable and the unit had 4 TVs...plenty to avoid fights over what to watch.  There was also loads of storage space including multiple large walk in closets.  The full size washer and dryer also came in handy.  The pool/lake area was very nice and the staff was helpful and accomodating.  We were arriving early from a cruise ship and there was no problem at all checking in early.  The location is convenient to all the parks/attractions and there are plenty of places to eat and shop in the immediate area.  I would advise trying to get a room away from the highway.  There was quite a lot of road noise in our master bedroom.

title: Really great place to stay!
review: We stayed at this resort this past weekend for 2 nights and were quite impressed. We expected to like it because of the reviews we read, but like it better than we hoped and will certainly plan to stay again. We had booked a 1 br. apartment, but when I checked in the girl gave me a total that was twice the rate I'd agreed to. I pointed this out to her and she immediately adjusted my total to the agreed amount. Apparently they had run out of the type of room we had reserved and had upgraded us and she had almost accidentally charged us for the upgrade. When we got to the room, it was twice as big as we expected. A large living room with 2 pull out couches, a full kitchen w/ granite counter tops, dining area, master suite with king sized bed and garden tub in bathroom, full sized…

title: No Complaints!
review: We stayed for 6 days in August.  The staff was fine.  As advised by the other reviews, I requested a room away from the road and on the second floor.  We were supposed to be in a 1 bedroom loft, but were upgraded to a 2 bedroom 2 bath.  Plenty of room.  Our kids liked the pool area.  Being so close to Walmart was a plus!  I agree with some others that daily housekeeping would be nice.  Great location!!!  You should book directly through them because I got an excellent rate.

title: A place to relax...
review: Check in was smooth, the rooms and grounds were clean. I did have a problem with the final price being more than what was quoted however Eric from reservations took care of it professionally and promptly.  Have no fear when booking hear as I may be letting the cat out of the bag on a good thing.

title: Loved Mikes New place
review: I travel to Orlando frequently with daughters and granddaughter (6 yrs old) Have stayed in most of disney's resorts and outside of park. Found Mike Ditka's new resort on line. All i can say was wonderful. We had a 2 bedroom 2 bath villa. fully loaded, flat screen tv in each room. spa tub in master. king size bed/ one twin and one full in the second bedroom. living room had 2 queen pull out sofas. Very easy to get to off Oseola Parkway. Great price for all you get. Clean, beautiful decor.  had indoor basketball, gym. 2 pools one for the little ones. the adult pool was small but that was the only issue. will go back in december for our Mickeys' xmas party vacation M Pontecorvi Lake Worth, Fla

title: Checked back out and went elesewhere
review: When I checked in, I was put in a unit at the back corner of the property  - even though I asked if I could be closer to the pool- Long walk to the pool - easier to drive up to that end.  It was not what I expected - no views from that location.  If you want to stay there, make sure you are up front near the pool  - I found a better place to stay and checked back out.

title: Great hotel for the value
review: Our party consisted of 3 adults, 3 children (16 and under) and 2 toddlers. The condo was an excellent value for the price. We had a two bedroom unit which had a king bed in the master room, two double beds in the second room, and two pull out sofa beds. It was clean, with all the amenities of home, close to all the theme parks, as well as to many different shops/restaurants/markets etc. The staff was friendly and helpful. We had an issue with a leak from the a/c unit which was taken care of by the maintenance staff. We would definitely stay here again

title: Great place to stay
review: My family and I stayed in a 3 bed Loft Condo on this complex.  The accommodation was spacious, clean and comfortable.  It would easily sleep 10 people, so the four of us had lots of room!!  The kitchen was well equip with fridge/freezer, dishwasher, cooker, micro and all the pots, pans, etc., that you could need.  The washer and dryer were also very useful.    We did not book this Condo in advance, but did a walk-in deal at the front desk for 129 dollars a night.  We thought this quite reasonable and stayed 9 nights.  The pool area was very good with the main pool, plus jacuzzi and a large kids pool too.  Only slight problem we had was with towels for the condo.  Housekeeping had a habit of taking all towels every day (clean and dirty) and didn't replace them.  This meant a…

title: Excellent for the price
review: Just returned from Orlando.  We were five adults staying in a two bedroom condo at Runaway Beach and we found the resort to be an excellent value for the price.  Master bedroom had king size bed and other bedroom had two full beds.  We found the condo very clean with spacious bedrooms, living room and kitchen.  Eating area a little small but acceptable.   Could use another chair in the living room though.  Very convenient to Universal Studios and Super Wal-Mart right around the corner.  Heated pool was great and hot tub was relaxing.  Only suggestion is they need more pots and pans in the kitchen for cooking.  Would definitely stay again but would bring additional pots and pans.

title: Peaceful End to Hectic Days
review: Runaway Beach Club Resort is a home away from home.  The four of us stayed in a two bedroom/ two bath condo.  We could have actually housed four more people with the two queen pull out sofas.  We were very satisfied with our 8 night stay here.  The accomodations are absolutely wonderful. We will definitely return.

title: Great!!
review: My family and I were looking for a nice and comfortable place to stay to accomodate 6 adults, and 2 kids. I came across the Runaway Beach Resort online and it seemed to be too good to be true for the price. When we called the hotel, directly, the price was even less than the price shown online. I checked the reviews on tripadvisor and it got very good reviews, so we decided to book it. We stayed in a two bedroom loft and boy was it comfortable!! It was very spacious, a modern kitchen, 3 sofa beds, a TV in the loft, in the livingroom and in the two bedrooms, washer and dryer. I must say it was a great stay! The pool was also very nice, the kiddie pool was too. They had nice music playing and you just felt like you were on an island vacationing. The only complain that I have is…

title: Worst Experience Ever
review: My family and I were traveling to Orlando to visit the usual theme parks and decided to stay outside of the parks.  I found this property via Hotels.com and read the reviews.  Even though many reviewers stated that the front desk was not helpful, I decided to give it a try.  When we got to the property, there were no signs to indicate that this was the Mike Ditka Resorts property, but it had the correct address so I went inside.  To say that the front desk staff were not helpful is an understatement.  The two women behind the desk stood there talking with each other and totally ignored me.  Then the security guard came in and told me that I had to move my car from the check-in area because it was blocking him in.  When I got back from moving my car, the women at the front desk…

title: A Hidden Treasure for an Unbelievable Price!
review: After spending seven nights at the Dolphin, a deluxe hotel on Disney property, we needed a place to stay for one additional day in Orlando.  We chose a two bedroom w/ loft at the Runaway Beach Club.  We paid quite a bit more for a small, yet nice, room with no kitchen and an even smaller bathroom at the Dolphin.  So, we were a little skeptical when the cost at the Runaway Beach Club was almost $60. p/ night less than at the Dolphin.  Wow!  We were not disappointed.  It was very clean and spacious, with a beautiful kitchen, two large bathrooms, free wireless internet access, and four televisions!  The new pool was gorgeous and the staff was very friendly and helpful.  This resort is located across from a fabulous deluxe name brand shopping outlet and is less than ten minutes from…

title: Unbelieveably beautiful and close to DISNEY!
review: OK, the place is gorgeous.  No doubt about that.  The price is low right now because it is new.  Stay there before it goes up due to rising demand and reputation.  Even at a higher price, it would be great to stay here again, but the low price is great!!  The sun deck is awesome, and I will post some of the best photos I took while there.  Even better, they are putting in a restaurant in the near future.  However, there are ample restaurants and Walmart right down the street.  It's only a few minutes from Disney and they even have a shuttle service!!  TIP:  Stay in one of the upstairs condos.  The floors and walls aren't paper-thin, but many people have kids and just the normal activity can transfer sound through the floors.  If you are upstairs this won't matter to you at all. …

title: Great place to stay.
review: I found this great place to stay in one of the Florida Discount booklets in a rest area.  The resort is very nice.  I got a one bedroom/ one bath villa with 2 tv's, full kitchen, washer and dryer, and a lake view for about 105.00 a night.  There is security and a gate which closes at night which you access with your room key card.  There is a workout room and an indoor basketball court.  Very nice pool with live music. (steel drums, island style).  The beds are super and I had good sleep.  There is a super-walmart located right down the street about 1/4 of a mile.  We got steaks there and cooked them in our room, yum yum.  TV's have about 99 channels with HBO.  The resort has sidewalks which go all around the area if you like to walk.  It is located about 5 miles from Disney so…

title: Home Away from Home!!
review: Runaway Beach Hotel was a great place to stay.  The location of the resort was excellent and close to shopping, restaurants, the amusement parks, and Wal-mart.  I was impressed with the staff.  They were very accomodating and friendly.  The service was fast and with a smile.  I did not pay the extra amount for housekeeping, but it was okay because they provide you with a vaccuum cleaner, broom and dust pan.  I bought a few cleaning supplies and everything was great.
